+   424â†’## Common Workflows

+   483â†’## CLI Reference
+   484â†’
+   485â†’### controller-deploy list
+   486â†’
+   487â†’List connected controllers and available configurations.

+   505â†’### controller-deploy deploy
+   506â†’
+   507â†’Deploy controller configuration to DAW(s).
+   508â†’
+   509â†’**Options:**
+   510â†’- `-c, --controller <type>`: Controller type (auto-detect if omitted)
+   511â†’- `-s, --slot <number>`: Configuration slot (default: 0)
+   512â†’- `-d, --daw <daws...>`: Target DAWs (default: ardour)
+   513â†’- `-p, --plugin <name>`: Plugin name for context
+   514â†’- `-m, --midi-channel <number>`: MIDI channel override
+   515â†’- `-o, --output <dir>`: Output directory for canonical YAML
+   516â†’- `--install`: Auto-install to DAW config directories
+   517â†’- `--dry-run`: Preview without deploying
+   518â†’
+   519â†’**Examples:**
+   520â†’\```bash
+   521â†’# Basic deployment
+   522â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour
+   523â†’
+   524â†’# Multiple DAWs
+   525â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live
+   526â†’
+   527â†’# With plugin context
+   528â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --daw ardour
+   529â†’
+   530â†’# Save canonical and install
+   531â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --output ./mappings --install
+   532â†’
+   533â†’# Preview only
+   534â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour --dry-run
+   535â†’\```

+   537â†’## Troubleshooting
+   538â†’
+   539â†’### Plugin Interrogation Issues
+   540â†’
+   541â†’**Problem:** Plugin crashes during scan
+   542â†’\```bash
+   543â†’# Skip problematic plugins by editing
+   544â†’modules/canonical-midi-maps/src/tools/batch-plugin-generator.ts
+   545â†’
+   546â†’const SKIP_PATTERNS = [
+   547â†’  /UAD/i,           # Universal Audio plugins
+   548â†’  /Waves/i,         # Waves plugins (if problematic)
+   549â†’  /YourPlugin/i     # Add problematic plugin
+   550â†’];
+   551â†’\```
+   552â†’
+   553â†’**Problem:** No parameters found
+   554â†’- Check plugin format (VST3 required)
+   555â†’- Verify plugin is installed correctly
+   556â†’- Try manual interrogation: `plughost --interrogate /path/to/plugin.vst3`
+   557â†’
+   558â†’### Canonical Mapping Issues
+   559â†’
+   560â†’**Problem:** Wrong parameter indices
+   561â†’- Verify plugin descriptor exists and is current
+   562â†’- Check parameter index in descriptor JSON
+   563â†’- Regenerate descriptor if plugin was updated
+   564â†’
+   565â†’**Problem:** YAML validation errors
+   566â†’- Check YAML syntax (indentation, colons, quotes)
+   567â†’- Verify required fields (version, device, plugin, controls)
+   568â†’- Use YAML validator: `npx js-yaml --validate mapping.yaml`
+   569â†’
+   570â†’### Deployment Issues
+   571â†’
+   572â†’**Problem:** Ardour map not appearing
+   573â†’- Check installation path: `~/Library/Preferences/Ardour8/midi_maps/`
+   574â†’- Verify XML is valid: `xmllint --noout mapping.map`
+   575â†’- Restart Ardour after installation
+   576â†’
+   577â†’**Problem:** Live mapping not working
+   578â†’- Check `plugin-mappings.json` syntax
+   579â†’- Verify runtime-loader is loading file
+   580â†’- Check Max for Live device logs
+   581â†’- Ensure plugin name matches exactly
+   582â†’
+   583â†’**Problem:** Controller not detected
+   584â†’- Check MIDI connections (Web MIDI API requires Chrome/Edge)
+   585â†’- Verify controller is powered on
+   586â†’- Try manual adapter creation (bypass auto-detection)
+   587â†’
+   588â†’## Performance Tips
+   589â†’
+   590â†’### Cache Plugin Descriptors
+   591â†’
+   592â†’Plugin interrogation is cached for 24 hours. To force refresh:
+   593â†’\```bash
+   594â†’rm plugin-descriptors/plugins-catalog-batch.json
+   595â†’pnpm plugin:generate-batch
+   596â†’\```
+   597â†’
+   598â†’### Batch Deployments
+   599â†’
+   600â†’Deploy multiple configurations in one script:
+   601â†’\```bash
+   602â†’#!/bin/bash
+   603â†’for slot in {0..3}; do
+   604â†’  npx controller-deploy deploy --slot $slot --daw ardour live --install
+   605â†’done
+   606â†’\```
+   607â†’
+   608â†’### Validate Before Deploy
+   609â†’
+   610â†’Use dry-run to verify before actual deployment:
+   611â†’\```bash
+   612â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live --dry-run
+   613â†’# Review output, then run without --dry-run
+   614â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live --install
+   615â†’\```

+   349â†’## Design Patterns
+   350â†’
+   351â†’### Interface-First Design
+   352â†’
+   353â†’All major components define interfaces before implementation:
+   354â†’- Enables testing with mocks
+   355â†’- Clear contracts between layers
+   356â†’- Easier to extend and maintain
+   357â†’
+   358â†’### Dependency Injection
+   359â†’
+   360â†’\```typescript
+   361â†’export class DeploymentWorkflow {
+   362â†’  constructor(
+   363â†’    private controllerAdapter: ControllerAdapterInterface,

+   366â†’  ) {}
+   367â†’}
+   368â†’\```
+   369â†’
+   370â†’Benefits:
+   371â†’- Testable (inject mocks)
+   372â†’- Flexible (swap implementations)
+   373â†’- Follows project guidelines
+   374â†’
+   375â†’### Factory Pattern
+   376â†’
+   377â†’\```typescript
+   378â†’static async create(options: CreateOptions): Promise<DeploymentWorkflow> {

+   384â†’}
+   385â†’\```

+   390â†’- Encapsulates complexity

+   421â†’### Optimization Strategies
+   422â†’
+   423â†’- **Caching:** Controller configurations cached between deployments
+   424â†’- **Lazy loading:** DAW deployers loaded on-demand
+   425â†’- **Async operations:** Non-blocking I/O for file operations
+   426â†’- **Streaming:** Large maps processed in chunks

+   429â†’
+   430â†’- **File system access:** Validates output paths before writing
+   431â†’- **MIDI input:** Validates SysEx messages before parsing
+   432â†’- **Command injection:** No shell command execution (direct API calls only)
+   433â†’- **Path traversal:** Sanitizes file paths in output directory options

+   337â†’## Phase 3: Launch Control XL3 Converter
+   338â†’
+   339â†’**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/converters/LaunchControlXL3Converter.ts`
+   340â†’
+   341â†’\```typescript
+   342â†’export class LaunchControlXL3Converter implements CanonicalConverterInterface {
+   343â†’
+   344â†’  getConverterInfo(): ConverterInfo {
+   345â†’    return {
+   346â†’      supportedController: 'Novation Launch Control XL 3',
+   347â†’      version: '1.0.0',
+   348â†’      features: ['custom-modes', 'label-preservation', 'all-control-types']
+   349â†’    };
+   350â†’  }
+   351â†’
+   352â†’  canConvert(config: ControllerConfiguration): boolean {
+   353â†’    // Validate config has required LCXL3 structure
+   354â†’    return config.controls.length > 0 &&
+   355â†’           config.controls.every(c => c.cc !== undefined);
+   356â†’  }
+   357â†’
+   358â†’  convert(
+   359â†’    config: ControllerConfiguration,
+   360â†’    options: ConversionOptions
+   361â†’  ): CanonicalMidiMap {
+   362â†’    return {
+   363â†’      version: '1.0.0',
+   364â†’      device: {
+   365â†’        manufacturer: 'Novation',
+   366â†’        model: 'Launch Control XL 3',
+   367â†’        ...(options.deviceOverrides || {})
+   368â†’      },
+   369â†’      metadata: {
+   370â†’        name: config.name,
+   371â†’        description: `Converted from LCXL3 custom mode: ${config.name}`,
+   372â†’        date: new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0],
+   373â†’        tags: ['launch-control-xl3', 'auto-generated']
+   374â†’      },
+   375â†’      plugin: options.pluginInfo,
+   376â†’      midi_channel: options.midiChannel,
+   377â†’      controls: this.mapControls(config.controls, options)
+   378â†’    };
+   379â†’  }
+   380â†’
+   381â†’  private mapControls(controls: ControlMapping[], options: ConversionOptions): ControlDefinition[] {
+   382â†’    return controls.map(control => ({
+   383â†’      id: this.mapControlId(control.id),        // SEND_A1 â†’ encoder_1
+   384â†’      name: options.preserveLabels ? control.name : this.getDefaultName(control.id),
+   385â†’      type: this.mapControlType(control.type),
+   386â†’      cc: control.cc!,
+   387â†’      channel: control.channel ?? options.midiChannel ?? 0,
+   388â†’      range: control.range || [0, 127],
+   389â†’      description: `Mapped from ${control.id}`

+   391â†’  }
+   392â†’
+   393â†’  private mapControlId(lcxl3Id: string): string {
+   394â†’    // LCXL3-specific mapping: SEND_A1 â†’ encoder_1, FADER1 â†’ slider_1, etc.
+   395â†’    const mapping: Record<string, string> = {
+   396â†’      'SEND_A1': 'encoder_1', 'SEND_A2': 'encoder_2', 'SEND_A3': 'encoder_3',
+   397â†’      'SEND_A4': 'encoder_4', 'SEND_A5': 'encoder_5', 'SEND_A6': 'encoder_6',
+   398â†’      'SEND_A7': 'encoder_7', 'SEND_A8': 'encoder_8',
+   399â†’      'SEND_B1': 'encoder_9', 'SEND_B2': 'encoder_10', 'SEND_B3': 'encoder_11',
+   400â†’      'SEND_B4': 'encoder_12', 'SEND_B5': 'encoder_13', 'SEND_B6': 'encoder_14',
+   401â†’      'SEND_B7': 'encoder_15', 'SEND_B8': 'encoder_16',
+   402â†’      'PAN1': 'encoder_17', 'PAN2': 'encoder_18', 'PAN3': 'encoder_19',
+   403â†’      'PAN4': 'encoder_20', 'PAN5': 'encoder_21', 'PAN6': 'encoder_22',
+   404â†’      'PAN7': 'encoder_23', 'PAN8': 'encoder_24',
+   405â†’      'FADER1': 'slider_1', 'FADER2': 'slider_2', 'FADER3': 'slider_3',
+   406â†’      'FADER4': 'slider_4', 'FADER5': 'slider_5', 'FADER6': 'slider_6',
+   407â†’      'FADER7': 'slider_7', 'FADER8': 'slider_8',
+   408â†’      'FOCUS1': 'button_1', 'FOCUS2': 'button_2', 'FOCUS3': 'button_3',

+   410â†’      'FOCUS7': 'button_7', 'FOCUS8': 'button_8',
+   411â†’      'CONTROL1': 'button_9', 'CONTROL2': 'button_10', 'CONTROL3': 'button_11',
+   412â†’      'CONTROL4': 'button_12', 'CONTROL5': 'button_13', 'CONTROL6': 'button_14',
+   413â†’      'CONTROL7': 'button_15', 'CONTROL8': 'button_16'
+   414â†’    };
+   415â†’    return mapping[lcxl3Id] || lcxl3Id.toLowerCase();
+   416â†’  }
+   417â†’
+   418â†’  private mapControlType(type: ControlType): 'encoder' | 'slider' | 'button' | 'button_group' {
+   419â†’    return type;
+   420â†’  }

+   437â†’## Phase 4: Generalized Deployment Workflow
+   438â†’
+   439â†’**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/orchestrator/DeploymentWorkflow.ts`
+   440â†’
+   441â†’\```typescript
+   442â†’import { EventEmitter } from 'eventemitter3';
+   443â†’
+   444â†’export interface WorkflowOptions {
+   445â†’  configSlot: number;
+   446â†’  targets: string[];
+   447â†’  pluginInfo?: PluginDefinition;
+   448â†’  midiChannel?: number;
+   449â†’  preserveLabels?: boolean;
+   450â†’  outputDir?: string;
+   451â†’  autoInstall?: boolean;
+   452â†’  dryRun?: boolean;
+   453â†’}
+   454â†’
+   455â†’export interface WorkflowResult {
+   456â†’  success: boolean;
+   457â†’  controllerConfig?: ControllerConfiguration;
+   458â†’  canonicalMap?: CanonicalMidiMap;
+   459â†’  deployments: DeploymentResult[];
+   460â†’  errors: string[];
+   461â†’}
+   462â†’
+   463â†’export interface CreateOptions {
+   464â†’  controllerAdapter?: ControllerAdapterInterface;
+   465â†’  targets: string[];
+   466â†’}
+   467â†’
+   468â†’export class DeploymentWorkflow extends EventEmitter {
+   469â†’  constructor(
+   470â†’    private controllerAdapter: ControllerAdapterInterface,
+   471â†’    private converter: CanonicalConverterInterface,
+   472â†’    private deployers: Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>
+   473â†’  ) {
+   474â†’    super();
+   475â†’  }
+   476â†’
+   477â†’  static async create(options: CreateOptions): Promise<DeploymentWorkflow> {
+   478â†’    // Auto-detect controller or use specified adapter
+   479â†’    const adapter = options.controllerAdapter || await this.detectController();
+   480â†’
+   481â†’    // Get appropriate converter for detected controller
+   482â†’    const converter = this.getConverterFor(adapter);
+   483â†’
+   484â†’    // Initialize DAW deployers
+   485â†’    const deployers = new Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>();
+   486â†’    if (options.targets.includes('ardour')) {
+   487â†’      const { ArdourDeployer } = await import('../adapters/daws/ArdourDeployer.js');
+   488â†’      deployers.set('ardour', new ArdourDeployer());
+   489â†’    }
+   490â†’    if (options.targets.includes('live')) {
+   491â†’      const { LiveDeployer } = await import('../adapters/daws/LiveDeployer.js');
+   492â†’      deployers.set('live', new LiveDeployer());
+   493â†’    }
+   494â†’
+   495â†’    return new DeploymentWorkflow(adapter, converter, deployers);
+   496â†’  }
+   497â†’
+   498â†’  async execute(options: WorkflowOptions): Promise<WorkflowResult> {
+   499â†’    const errors: string[] = [];
+   500â†’
+   501â†’    try {
+   502â†’      // Step 1: Read configuration from controller
+   503â†’      this.emit('progress', { step: 1, message: 'Reading controller configuration...' });
+   504â†’      const config = await this.controllerAdapter.readConfiguration(options.configSlot);
+   505â†’
+   506â†’      // Step 2: Convert to canonical format
+   507â†’      this.emit('progress', { step: 2, message: 'Converting to canonical format...' });
+   508â†’      const canonicalMap = this.converter.convert(config, {
+   509â†’        pluginInfo: options.pluginInfo,
+   510â†’        midiChannel: options.midiChannel,
+   511â†’        preserveLabels: options.preserveLabels ?? true
+   512â†’      });
+   513â†’
+   514â†’      // Step 3: Save canonical YAML (optional)
+   515â†’      if (options.outputDir) {
+   516â†’        await this.saveCanonical(canonicalMap, options.outputDir);
+   517â†’      }
+   518â†’
+   519â†’      // Step 4: Deploy to each target DAW
+   520â†’      this.emit('progress', { step: 3, message: 'Deploying to DAWs...' });
+   521â†’      const deployments: DeploymentResult[] = [];
+   522â†’
+   523â†’      for (const target of options.targets) {
+   524â†’        const deployer = this.deployers.get(target);
+   525â†’        if (deployer) {
+   526â†’          const result = await deployer.deploy(canonicalMap, {
+   527â†’            autoInstall: options.autoInstall,
+   528â†’            dryRun: options.dryRun
+   529â†’          });
+   530â†’          deployments.push(result);
+   531â†’          if (!result.success) {
+   532â†’            errors.push(...(result.errors || [`${target} deployment failed`]));
+   533â†’          }
+   534â†’        } else {
+   535â†’          errors.push(`No deployer available for ${target}`);
+   536â†’        }
+   537â†’      }
+   538â†’
+   539â†’      return {
+   540â†’        success: deployments.every(d => d.success) && errors.length === 0,
+   541â†’        controllerConfig: config,
+   542â†’        canonicalMap,
+   543â†’        deployments,
+   544â†’        errors
+   545â†’      };
+   546â†’
+   547â†’    } catch (error) {
+   548â†’      errors.push(error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error));
+   549â†’      return {
+   550â†’        success: false,
+   551â†’        deployments: [],
+   552â†’        errors
+   553â†’      };
+   554â†’    }
+   555â†’  }
+   556â†’
+   557â†’  getControllerAdapter(): ControllerAdapterInterface {
+   558â†’    return this.controllerAdapter;
+   559â†’  }
+   560â†’
+   561â†’  private async saveCanonical(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, outputDir: string): Promise<void> {
+   562â†’    const yaml = await import('yaml');
+   563â†’    const { writeFileSync, mkdirSync } = await import('fs');
+   564â†’    const { join } = await import('path');
+   565â†’
+   566â†’    mkdirSync(outputDir, { recursive: true });
+   567â†’    const filename = `${canonicalMap.device.model.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-')}-${canonicalMap.metadata.name.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-')}.yaml`;
+   568â†’    const filepath = join(outputDir, filename);
+   569â†’
+   570â†’    writeFileSync(filepath, yaml.stringify(canonicalMap));
+   571â†’    this.emit('canonical-saved', { path: filepath });
+   572â†’  }
+   573â†’
+   574â†’  private static async detectController(): Promise<ControllerAdapterInterface> {
+   575â†’    // Try to detect connected controller
+   576â†’    // Start with LCXL3, add more controllers later
+   577â†’    try {
+   578â†’      const { LaunchControlXL3Adapter } = await import('../adapters/controllers/LaunchControlXL3Adapter.js');
+   579â†’      return await LaunchControlXL3Adapter.create();
+   580â†’    } catch {
+   581â†’      throw new Error('No supported controller detected');
+   582â†’    }
+   583â†’  }
+   584â†’
+   585â†’  private static getConverterFor(adapter: ControllerAdapterInterface): CanonicalConverterInterface {
+   586â†’    // Registry of converters by controller model
+   587â†’    if (adapter.model === 'Launch Control XL 3') {
+   588â†’      const { LaunchControlXL3Converter } = require('../converters/LaunchControlXL3Converter.js');
+   589â†’      return new LaunchControlXL3Converter();
+   590â†’    }
+   591â†’    throw new Error(`No converter available for ${adapter.model}`);
+   592â†’  }
+   593â†’}
+   594â†’\```

+   598â†’- âœ… Auto-detects connected controller
+   599â†’- âœ… Supports multiple DAW targets simultaneously

+   730â†’
+   731â†’\```typescript
+   732â†’import { MidiMapBuilder, ArdourXMLSerializer } from '@oletizi/ardour-midi-maps';
+   733â†’
+   734â†’export class ArdourDeployer implements DAWDeployerInterface {
+   735â†’  readonly dawName = 'Ardour';
+   736â†’  readonly version = '8.0';
+   737â†’
+   738â†’  async deploy(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, options: DeploymentOptions): Promise<DeploymentResult> {
+   739â†’    try {
+   740â†’      // Convert canonical â†’ Ardour XML
+   741â†’      const ardourMap = this.convertToArdour(canonicalMap);
+   742â†’      const serializer = new ArdourXMLSerializer();

+   745â†’      // Determine output path

+   747â†’
+   748â†’      if (!options.dryRun) {
+   749â†’        const { writeFileSync, mkdirSync } = await import('fs');

+  ): ParameterMatchResult[] {
+    // Extract JSON from response (Claude might wrap it in markdown code blocks)
+    const jsonMatch = response.match(/\[[\s\S]*\]/);
+    if (!jsonMatch) {
+      throw new Error(`Could not find JSON array in Claude response: ${response.substring(0, 200)}`);
+    }
+
+    let parsed: unknown;
+    try {
+      parsed = JSON.parse(jsonMatch[0]);
+    } catch (error) {
+      throw new Error(`Failed to parse Claude response as JSON: ${error}`);
+    }
+
+    if (!Array.isArray(parsed)) {
+      throw new Error('Claude response is not an array');
+    }
+
+    // Validate and transform response
+    const results: ParameterMatchResult[] = [];
+
+    for (let i = 0; i < controlNames.length; i++) {
+      const controlName = controlNames[i];
+      const match = parsed[i];
+
+      if (!match || typeof match !== 'object') {
+        // If Claude didn't provide a match for this control, add a no-match result
+        results.push({
+          controlName,
+          confidence: 0,
+          reasoning: 'No match found',
+        });
+        continue;
+      }
+
+      const paramIndex = match.parameterIndex;
+      const confidence = typeof match.confidence === 'number' ? match.confidence : 0;
+      const reasoning = typeof match.reasoning === 'string' ? match.reasoning : '';
+
+      if (paramIndex === null || paramIndex === undefined || paramIndex < 0) {
+        results.push({
+          controlName,
+          confidence,
+          reasoning,
+        });
+        continue;
+      }
+
+      // Validate parameter index
+      const parameter = pluginDescriptor.parameters[paramIndex];
+      if (!parameter) {
+        results.push({
+          controlName,
+          confidence: 0,
+          reasoning: `Invalid parameter index ${paramIndex}`,
+        });
+        continue;
+      }
+
+      results.push({
+        controlName,
+        pluginParameter: paramIndex,
+        parameterName: parameter.name,
+        confidence,
+        reasoning,
+      });
+    }
+
+    return results;
+  }
+}
+
+/**
+ * Load a plugin descriptor from the canonical-midi-maps registry.
+ *
+ * Looks up plugin descriptor files by manufacturer and plugin name,
+ * normalizing names to match filesystem conventions.
+ *
+ * @param pluginName - Plugin name (e.g., "TAL-J-8" or "tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8")
+ * @returns Promise resolving to plugin descriptor
+ * @throws Error if descriptor file not found or cannot be loaded
+ */
+export async function loadPluginDescriptor(pluginName: string): Promise<PluginDescriptor> {
+  // Normalize plugin name to filename format
+  const normalizedName = pluginName.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-');
+
+  // Find the canonical-midi-maps module
+  // Navigate from controller-workflow to canonical-midi-maps
+  const baseDir = path.resolve(__dirname, '../../canonical-midi-maps/plugin-descriptors');
+
+  // Try to find matching descriptor file
+  let descriptorPath: string | undefined;
+
+  try {
+    const files = await fs.readdir(baseDir);
+
+    // Look for exact match or substring match
+    const matchingFile = files.find(
+      (file) => file === `${normalizedName}.json` || file.includes(normalizedName)
+    );
+
+    if (matchingFile) {
+      descriptorPath = path.join(baseDir, matchingFile);
+    }
+  } catch (error) {
+    throw new Error(`Failed to read plugin descriptors directory: ${error}`);
+  }
+
+  if (!descriptorPath) {
+    throw new Error(
+      `Plugin descriptor not found for "${pluginName}". ` +
+        `Searched in ${baseDir} for files matching "${normalizedName}"`
+    );
+  }
+
+  // Load and parse the descriptor
+  try {
+    const content = await fs.readFile(descriptorPath, 'utf-8');
+    const descriptor = JSON.parse(content) as PluginDescriptor;
+
+    // Validate basic structure
+    if (!descriptor.plugin || !descriptor.parameters) {
+      throw new Error('Invalid plugin descriptor structure: missing plugin or parameters');
+    }
+
+    return descriptor;
+  } catch (error) {
+    throw new Error(`Failed to load plugin descriptor from ${descriptorPath}: ${error}`);
+  }
+}

+## Phase 1: Plugin Interrogation
+
+### Purpose
+
+Extract accurate parameter information from audio plugins to ensure mappings use real, valid parameter indices.
+
+### Prerequisites
+
+- JUCE-based plughost binary (built from project)
+- Installed VST3 plugins
+- canonical-midi-maps module
+
+### Process
+
+#### Step 1: Build Plugin Host
+
+\```bash
+# From project root
+cd path/to/juce-plughost
+make
+# Binary output: build/plughost
+\```
+
+#### Step 2: Run Batch Interrogation
+
+\```bash
+# Navigate to canonical-midi-maps
+cd modules/audio-control/modules/canonical-midi-maps
+
+# Run batch plugin scanning
+pnpm plugin:generate-batch
+\```
+
+**What happens:**
+1. Launches `plughost` with `--batch-interrogate` flag
+2. Scans all VST3 plugins in standard directories
+3. Skips problematic plugins (UAD, etc.)
+4. Extracts parameter information for each plugin
+5. Outputs JSON stanzas to log file
+6. Caches results for 24 hours
+
+#### Step 3: Process Results
+
+The batch generator automatically:
+- Reads JSON stanzas from plughost output
+- Converts to structured plugin descriptors
+- Categorizes parameters (oscillator, filter, envelope, etc.)
+- Saves individual descriptor files
+- Updates catalog index
+
+### Output
+
+\```
+plugin-descriptors/
+â”œâ”€â”€ tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json      # Jupiter-8 emulation
+â”œâ”€â”€ arturia-jup-8-v4.json                  # Arturia version
+â”œâ”€â”€ analogobsession-channev.json           # Channel strip
+â””â”€â”€ plugins-catalog-batch.json             # Master catalog
+\```
+
+### Example Plugin Descriptor
+
+\```json
+{
+  "plugin": {
+    "manufacturer": "TAL-Togu Audio Line",
+    "name": "TAL-J-8",
+    "version": "1.0.0",
+    "format": "VST3",
+    "uid": "-664001267"
+  },
+  "metadata": {
+    "parameter_count": 2234,

+## Phase 2: Canonical Mapping
+
+### Purpose
+
+Create device-specific MIDI controller â†’ plugin parameter mappings using accurate parameter indices from Phase 1.
+
+### Two Approaches
+
+#### Approach A: Manual YAML Creation (Traditional)
+
+1. Choose hardware controller (e.g., Launch Control XL 3)
+2. Choose target plugin (e.g., TAL-J-8)
+3. Reference plugin descriptor for parameter indices
+4. Create YAML mapping file
+
+#### Approach B: Hardware Extraction (360 Feature) â­
+
+1. Create custom mode on hardware controller
+2. Label controls with parameter names
+3. Use `controller-deploy` to extract configuration
+4. Automatically generate canonical mapping
+5. **AI-powered parameter matching** (Phase 2.5)
+
+### Manual YAML Creation
+
+#### Step 1: Choose Target Combination
+
+- **Hardware:** Novation Launch Control XL 3
+- **Plugin:** TAL-J-8
+- **Descriptor:** `plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json`
+
+#### Step 2: Create YAML File
+
+**Location:** `maps/novation-launch-control-xl-3/roland-jupiter-8/tal-j8.yaml`

+### Hardware Extraction (One-Click Deployment) â­
+
+#### Step 1: Create Custom Mode on Controller
+
+Using Novation Components software:
+1. Open Launch Control XL 3 editor
+2. Create new custom mode in slot 0
+3. Assign CC numbers to controls
+4. **Label each control** with parameter name
+5. Save to device
+
+#### Step 2: Extract Configuration
+
+\```bash
+# List available configurations
+npx controller-deploy list
+
+# Output:
+# ğŸ“± Detected: Novation Launch Control XL 3
+#
+# Available configurations:
+#   Slot 0: Jupiter-8 Template
+#   Slot 1: Minimoog Template
+#   Slot 2: (empty)
+#   ...
+\```
+
+#### Step 3: Deploy to DAWs
+
+\```bash
+# Deploy single DAW
+npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour
+
+# Deploy multiple DAWs
+npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live
+
+# With plugin context (triggers fuzzy matching)
+npx controller-deploy deploy \
+  --slot 0 \
+  --plugin "TAL-J-8" \
+  --daw ardour live \
+  --install
+
+# Save canonical map for reference
+npx controller-deploy deploy \
+  --slot 0 \
+  --output ./my-mappings \
+  --install
+\```
+
+**What happens:**
+1. Reads custom mode from controller slot 0
+2. Extracts control assignments and labels
+3. Converts to canonical MIDI map format
+4. **[Phase 2.5] AI-powered fuzzy matching** (when --plugin provided)
+5. Deploys to specified DAWs
+6. Optionally saves canonical YAML
+

+### Integration Methods
+
+#### Method 1: Claude CLI (Preferred)
+
+\```typescript
+// Shell out to claude CLI
+const result = await execAsync(
+  `claude --prompt "Match these control names to plugin parameters: ${JSON.stringify(controls)}" --plugin-descriptor ${descriptorPath}`
+);
+\```
+
+**Requirements:**
+- `claude` CLI installed and in PATH
+- API key configured in environment
+
+#### Method 2: Anthropic API (Direct)
+
+\```typescript
+import Anthropic from '@anthropic-ai/sdk';
+
+const anthropic = new Anthropic({
+  apiKey: process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY,
+});
+
+const message = await anthropic.messages.create({
+  model: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022',
+  max_tokens: 1024,
+  messages: [{
+    role: 'user',
+    content: `Match control names to plugin parameters:\n${prompt}`
+  }],
+});
+\```
+
+### Matching Algorithm
+
+Claude AI analyzes:
+1. **Semantic similarity**: "VCF Cutoff" matches "VCF Cutoff" (exact)
+2. **Abbreviations**: "Filter Res" matches "VCF Resonance"
+3. **Synonyms**: "Env Attack" matches "Attack Time"
+4. **Context**: Groups related parameters (filters, envelopes, etc.)
+5. **Confidence scoring**: Returns match confidence for validation
+
+### Example Prompt
+
+\```
+You are a MIDI parameter matching expert. Match hardware control names to plugin parameters.
+
+Hardware Controls:
+- VCF Cutoff (CC 13)
+- Filter Res (CC 14)
+- Env Attack (CC 53)
+- LFO Rate (CC 21)
+
+Plugin Parameters (TAL-J-8):
+- [105] VCF Cutoff
+- [107] VCF Resonance
+- [109] VCF Envelope Amount
+- [65] Attack Time
+- [67] Decay Time
+- [89] LFO 1 Rate
+- [91] LFO 1 Amount
+
+Return JSON with matches:
+{
+  "matches": [
+    { "control": "VCF Cutoff", "cc": 13, "parameter": 105, "confidence": 1.0 },
+    { "control": "Filter Res", "cc": 14, "parameter": 107, "confidence": 0.95 },
+    ...
+  ]
+}
+\```
+
+### Output Format
+
+\```json
+{
+  "matches": [
+    {
+      "control_name": "VCF Cutoff",
+      "control_cc": 13,
+      "parameter_index": 105,
+      "parameter_name": "VCF Cutoff",
+      "confidence": 1.0,
+      "match_type": "exact"
+    },
+    {
+      "control_name": "Filter Res",

+    }
+  ],
+  "unmatched": []
+}
+\```
+
+### Troubleshooting Fuzzy Matching
+
+#### Problem: No matches found
+
+**Causes:**
+- Plugin descriptor not found
+- Control names too generic ("Knob 1", "Encoder A")
+- Plugin parameters unnamed or use internal IDs
+
+**Solutions:**
+\```bash
+# Verify plugin descriptor exists
+ls plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json
+
+# Use more descriptive control names in hardware
+# Good: "VCF Cutoff", "Resonance", "Attack"
+# Bad: "Knob1", "Enc A", "Control 1"
+
+# Manually specify parameter indices in YAML if AI fails
+\```
+
+#### Problem: Wrong parameter matched
+
+**Causes:**
+- Ambiguous control names
+- Multiple parameters with similar names
+- Low confidence matches
+
+**Solutions:**
+\```bash
+# Review match confidence scores
+# Confidence < 0.7 may indicate ambiguous match
+
+# Use more specific control names
+# Instead of: "Cutoff" â†’ "VCF Cutoff"
+# Instead of: "Attack" â†’ "Env 1 Attack"
+
+# Override matches in canonical YAML
+\```
+
+#### Problem: Claude API errors
+
+**Causes:**
+- API key not configured
+- Rate limiting
+- Network issues
+
+**Solutions:**
+\```bash
+# Set API key
+export ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_api_key
+
+# Or use claude CLI
+which claude  # Verify CLI installed
+claude --version
+
+# Check rate limits in Anthropic Console
+# Retry with exponential backoff
+\```
+
+#### Problem: Slow matching performance
+
+**Solutions:**
+\```bash
+# Cache matches for reuse
+# Matches saved in canonical YAML
+
+# Batch multiple controls in single API call
+# Faster than individual requests
+
+# Use local descriptor cache
+# Avoid re-reading descriptor files
+\```

+### Ableton Live Deployment (Dual-Pipeline)
+
+#### Automatic (via controller-deploy)
+
+\```bash
+npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw live --install
+\```
+
+**What happens:**
+1. Converts canonical map to plugin mapping format
+2. **AI-matched parameters included in JSON**
+3. Writes to `live-max-cc-router/data/plugin-mappings.json`
+4. Runtime loader merges with canonical mappings
+5. Max for Live device uses merged mappings
+
+**Dual-Pipeline Architecture:**
+
+\```
+Tier 1: Canonical (Build-time)         Tier 2: Runtime (Device-extracted)
+â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€            â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
+Source: YAML files                      Source: Controller slot
+Build:  convert-canonical-maps.cjs     Extract: controller-deploy
+Output: canonical-plugin-maps.ts        Output: plugin-mappings.json
+                                                (with AI-matched params)

+## Common Workflows
+
+### Workflow 1: New Plugin Mapping (Manual)
+
+\```bash
+# 1. Extract plugin parameters
+cd modules/canonical-midi-maps
+pnpm plugin:generate-batch
+
+# 2. Create canonical mapping (edit YAML)
+vim maps/novation-launch-control-xl-3/synth-category/my-plugin.yaml
+
+# 3. Generate Ardour map
+cd ../ardour-midi-maps
+pnpm generate:install
+
+# 4. Use in Ardour
+# (Select in control surface preferences)
+\```
+
+### Workflow 2: One-Click Hardware Extraction with AI Matching â­
+
+\```bash
+# 1. Create custom mode on controller (use Novation Components)
+# 2. Deploy in one command with AI-powered parameter matching
+npx controller-deploy deploy \
+  --slot 0 \
+  --plugin "TAL-J-8" \
+  --daw ardour live \
+  --install \
+  --output ./my-mappings
+
+# Done! Both DAWs configured from hardware with AI-matched parameters
+\```
+
+### Workflow 3: Update Existing Mapping
+
+\```bash
+# 1. Edit canonical YAML
+vim maps/novation-launch-control-xl-3/synth/my-plugin.yaml
+
+# 2. Regenerate Ardour map
+cd modules/ardour-midi-maps
+pnpm generate:install
+
+# 3. Live updates automatically (watches JSON file)
+\```
+
+### Workflow 4: Multi-Plugin Session
+
+\```bash
+# Deploy multiple plugins from controller slots with AI matching
+npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --daw ardour live
+npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 1 --plugin "Mini V4" --daw ardour live
+npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 2 --plugin "Jup-8 V4" --daw ardour live
+
+# All three plugins now mapped from hardware with AI-matched parameters
+\```
+
+## CLI Reference
+
+### controller-deploy list
+
+List connected controllers and available configurations.
+
+\```bash
+npx controller-deploy list
+\```
+
+**Output:**
+\```
+ğŸ“± Detected: Novation Launch Control XL 3
+
+Available configurations:
+  Slot 0: Jupiter-8 Template
+  Slot 1: Minimoog Template
+  Slot 2: (empty)
+  Slot 3: Channel Strip
+  ...
+\```
+
+### controller-deploy deploy
+
+Deploy controller configuration to DAW(s).
+
+**Options:**
+- `-c, --controller <type>`: Controller type (auto-detect if omitted)
+- `-s, --slot <number>`: Configuration slot (default: 0)
+- `-d, --daw <daws...>`: Target DAWs (default: ardour)
+- `-p, --plugin <name>`: Plugin name for AI parameter matching â­
+- `-m, --midi-channel <number>`: MIDI channel override
+- `-o, --output <dir>`: Output directory for canonical YAML
+- `--install`: Auto-install to DAW config directories
+- `--dry-run`: Preview without deploying
+
+**Examples:**
+\```bash
+# Basic deployment
+npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour
+
+# Multiple DAWs
+npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live
+
+# With plugin context (enables AI matching)
+npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --daw ardour
+
+# Save canonical and install
+npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --output ./mappings --install
+
+# Preview only
+npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour --dry-run
+\```
+
+## Troubleshooting
+
+### Plugin Interrogation Issues
+
+**Problem:** Plugin crashes during scan
+\```bash
+# Skip problematic plugins by editing
+modules/canonical-midi-maps/src/tools/batch-plugin-generator.ts
+
+const SKIP_PATTERNS = [
+  /UAD/i,           # Universal Audio plugins
+  /Waves/i,         # Waves plugins (if problematic)
+  /YourPlugin/i     # Add problematic plugin
+];
+\```
+
+**Problem:** No parameters found
+- Check plugin format (VST3 required)
+- Verify plugin is installed correctly
+- Try manual interrogation: `plughost --interrogate /path/to/plugin.vst3`
+
+### Canonical Mapping Issues
+
+**Problem:** Wrong parameter indices
+- Verify plugin descriptor exists and is current
+- Check parameter index in descriptor JSON
+- Regenerate descriptor if plugin was updated
+
+**Problem:** YAML validation errors
+- Check YAML syntax (indentation, colons, quotes)
+- Verify required fields (version, device, plugin, controls)
+- Use YAML validator: `npx js-yaml --validate mapping.yaml`
+
+### Fuzzy Matching Issues
+
+**Problem:** AI matching fails completely
+- Verify `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` environment variable set
+- Check `claude` CLI is installed: `which claude`
+- Ensure plugin descriptor exists and is valid
+- Check control names are descriptive (not "Knob1", "EncA")
+
+**Problem:** Low confidence matches (< 0.7)
+- Use more specific control names on hardware
+- Add semantic context ("VCF Cutoff" vs "Cutoff")
+- Manually override in canonical YAML if needed
+
+**Problem:** Multiple parameters matched to same control
+- Review match confidence scores in output
+- Use most specific parameter name on hardware
+- Manually specify correct parameter in YAML
+
+**Problem:** Rate limiting or API errors
+- Batch controls in single request (default behavior)
+- Add retry logic with exponential backoff
+- Use cached results when available
+
+### Deployment Issues
+
+**Problem:** Ardour map not appearing
+- Check installation path: `~/Library/Preferences/Ardour8/midi_maps/`
+- Verify XML is valid: `xmllint --noout mapping.map`
+- Restart Ardour after installation
+
+**Problem:** Live mapping not working
+- Check `plugin-mappings.json` syntax
+- Verify runtime-loader is loading file
+- Check Max for Live device logs
+- Ensure plugin name matches exactly
+
+**Problem:** Controller not detected
+- Check MIDI connections (Web MIDI API requires Chrome/Edge)
+- Verify controller is powered on
+- Try manual adapter creation (bypass auto-detection)
+
+## Performance Tips
+
+### Cache Plugin Descriptors
+
+Plugin interrogation is cached for 24 hours. To force refresh:
+\```bash
+rm plugin-descriptors/plugins-catalog-batch.json
+pnpm plugin:generate-batch
+\```
+
+### Cache AI Matches
+
+AI matches are saved in canonical YAML for reuse:
+\```bash
+# First deployment: AI matching runs (~2-5 seconds)
+npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --output ./cache
+
+# Subsequent deployments: Reads from cached YAML (~instant)
+npx controller-deploy deploy --input ./cache/lcxl3-jupiter8.yaml --daw ardour
+\```
+
+### Batch Deployments
+
+Deploy multiple configurations in one script:
+\```bash
+#!/bin/bash
+for slot in {0..3}; do
+  npx controller-deploy deploy --slot $slot --daw ardour live --install
+done
+\```
+
+### Validate Before Deploy
+
+Use dry-run to verify before actual deployment:
+\```bash
+npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live --dry-run
+# Review output, then run without --dry-run
+npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live --install
+\```

+   296â†’## Phase 2.5: AI-Powered Fuzzy Parameter Matching â­
+   297â†’
+   298â†’### Purpose
+   299â†’
+   300â†’Automatically match human-readable control names from hardware (e.g., "VCF Cutoff", "Env Attack") to plugin parameter indices using Claude AI.
+   301â†’

+   394â†’### Integration Methods
+   395â†’
+   396â†’#### Method 1: Claude CLI (Preferred)
+   397â†’
+   398â†’\```typescript
+   399â†’// Shell out to claude CLI
+   400â†’const result = await execAsync(
+   401â†’  `claude --prompt "Match these control names to plugin parameters: ${JSON.stringify(controls)}" --plugin-descriptor ${descriptorPath}`
+   402â†’);
+   403â†’\```
+   404â†’
+   405â†’**Requirements:**
+   406â†’- `claude` CLI installed and in PATH
+   407â†’- API key configured in environment
+   408â†’
+   409â†’#### Method 2: Anthropic API (Direct)
+   410â†’
+   411â†’\```typescript
+   412â†’import Anthropic from '@anthropic-ai/sdk';
+   413â†’
+   414â†’const anthropic = new Anthropic({
+   415â†’  apiKey: process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY,
+   416â†’});
+   417â†’
+   418â†’const message = await anthropic.messages.create({
+   419â†’  model: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022',
+   420â†’  max_tokens: 1024,
+   421â†’  messages: [{
+   422â†’    role: 'user',
+   423â†’    content: `Match control names to plugin parameters:\n${prompt}`
+   424â†’  }],
+   425â†’});
+   426â†’\```
+   427â†’
+   428â†’### Matching Algorithm
+   429â†’
+   430â†’Claude AI analyzes:
+   431â†’1. **Semantic similarity**: "VCF Cutoff" matches "VCF Cutoff" (exact)
+   432â†’2. **Abbreviations**: "Filter Res" matches "VCF Resonance"
+   433â†’3. **Synonyms**: "Env Attack" matches "Attack Time"
+   434â†’4. **Context**: Groups related parameters (filters, envelopes, etc.)
+   435â†’5. **Confidence scoring**: Returns match confidence for validation
+   436â†’
+   437â†’### Example Prompt
+   438â†’
+   439â†’\```
+   440â†’You are a MIDI parameter matching expert. Match hardware control names to plugin parameters.
+   441â†’
+   442â†’Hardware Controls:
+   443â†’- VCF Cutoff (CC 13)
+   444â†’- Filter Res (CC 14)
+   445â†’- Env Attack (CC 53)
+   446â†’- LFO Rate (CC 21)
+   447â†’
+   448â†’Plugin Parameters (TAL-J-8):
+   449â†’- [105] VCF Cutoff
+   450â†’- [107] VCF Resonance
+   451â†’- [109] VCF Envelope Amount
+   452â†’- [65] Attack Time
+   453â†’- [67] Decay Time
+   454â†’- [89] LFO 1 Rate
+   455â†’- [91] LFO 1 Amount
+   456â†’
+   457â†’Return JSON with matches:
+   458â†’{
+   459â†’  "matches": [
+   460â†’    { "control": "VCF Cutoff", "cc": 13, "parameter": 105, "confidence": 1.0 },
+   461â†’    { "control": "Filter Res", "cc": 14, "parameter": 107, "confidence": 0.95 },
+   462â†’    ...
+   463â†’  ]
+   464â†’}
+   465â†’\```
+   466â†’

+   469â†’\```json

+   501â†’### Troubleshooting Fuzzy Matching
+   502â†’
+   503â†’#### Problem: No matches found
+   504â†’
+   505â†’**Causes:**
+   506â†’- Plugin descriptor not found
+   507â†’- Control names too generic ("Knob 1", "Encoder A")
+   508â†’- Plugin parameters unnamed or use internal IDs
+   509â†’
+   510â†’**Solutions:**
+   511â†’\```bash
+   512â†’# Verify plugin descriptor exists
+   513â†’ls plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json
+   514â†’
+   515â†’# Use more descriptive control names in hardware
+   516â†’# Good: "VCF Cutoff", "Resonance", "Attack"
+   517â†’# Bad: "Knob1", "Enc A", "Control 1"
+   518â†’
+   519â†’# Manually specify parameter indices in YAML if AI fails
+   520â†’\```
+   521â†’
+   522â†’#### Problem: Wrong parameter matched
+   523â†’
+   524â†’**Causes:**
+   525â†’- Ambiguous control names
+   526â†’- Multiple parameters with similar names
+   527â†’- Low confidence matches
+   528â†’
+   529â†’**Solutions:**
+   530â†’\```bash
+   531â†’# Review match confidence scores
+   532â†’# Confidence < 0.7 may indicate ambiguous match
+   533â†’
+   534â†’# Use more specific control names
+   535â†’# Instead of: "Cutoff" â†’ "VCF Cutoff"
+   536â†’# Instead of: "Attack" â†’ "Env 1 Attack"
+   537â†’
+   538â†’# Override matches in canonical YAML
+   539â†’\```
+   540â†’
+   541â†’#### Problem: Claude API errors
+   542â†’
+   543â†’**Causes:**
+   544â†’- API key not configured
+   545â†’- Rate limiting
+   546â†’- Network issues
+   547â†’
+   548â†’**Solutions:**
+   549â†’\```bash
+   550â†’# Set API key
+   551â†’export ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_api_key
+   552â†’
+   553â†’# Or use claude CLI
+   554â†’which claude  # Verify CLI installed
+   555â†’claude --version
+   556â†’
+   557â†’# Check rate limits in Anthropic Console
+   558â†’# Retry with exponential backoff
+   559â†’\```
+   560â†’
+   561â†’#### Problem: Slow matching performance
+   562â†’
+   563â†’**Solutions:**
+   564â†’\```bash
+   565â†’# Cache matches for reuse
+   566â†’# Matches saved in canonical YAML
+   567â†’
+   568â†’# Batch multiple controls in single API call
+   569â†’# Faster than individual requests
+   570â†’
+   571â†’# Use local descriptor cache
+   572â†’# Avoid re-reading descriptor files
+   573â†’\```

+   640â†’### Ableton Live Deployment (Dual-Pipeline)
+   641â†’
+   642â†’#### Automatic (via controller-deploy)
+   643â†’
+   644â†’\```bash
+   645â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw live --install
+   646â†’\```
+   647â†’
+   648â†’**What happens:**
+   649â†’1. Converts canonical map to plugin mapping format
+   650â†’2. **AI-matched parameters included in JSON**
+   651â†’3. Writes to `live-max-cc-router/data/plugin-mappings.json`
+   652â†’4. Runtime loader merges with canonical mappings
+   653â†’5. Max for Live device uses merged mappings
+   654â†’
+   655â†’**Dual-Pipeline Architecture:**
+   656â†’
+   657â†’\```
+   658â†’Tier 1: Canonical (Build-time)         Tier 2: Runtime (Device-extracted)
+   659â†’â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€            â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
+   660â†’Source: YAML files                      Source: Controller slot
+   661â†’Build:  convert-canonical-maps.cjs     Extract: controller-deploy
+   662â†’Output: canonical-plugin-maps.ts        Output: plugin-mappings.json
+   663â†’                                                (with AI-matched params)
+   664â†’
+   665â†’                    Runtime Merge
+   666â†’                    { ...canonical, ...runtime }
+   667â†’\```
+   668â†’
+   669â†’See [live-deployer/architecture.md](./live-deployer/architecture.md) for details.

+   714â†’## Common Workflows
+   715â†’
+   716â†’### Workflow 1: New Plugin Mapping (Manual)
+   717â†’
+   718â†’\```bash
+   719â†’# 1. Extract plugin parameters
+   720â†’cd modules/canonical-midi-maps
+   721â†’pnpm plugin:generate-batch

+   795â†’### controller-deploy deploy
+   796â†’
+   797â†’Deploy controller configuration to DAW(s).
+   798â†’
+   799â†’**Options:**
+   800â†’- `-c, --controller <type>`: Controller type (auto-detect if omitted)
+   801â†’- `-s, --slot <number>`: Configuration slot (default: 0)
+   802â†’- `-d, --daw <daws...>`: Target DAWs (default: ardour)
+   803â†’- `-p, --plugin <name>`: Plugin name for AI parameter matching â­
+   804â†’- `-m, --midi-channel <number>`: MIDI channel override
+   805â†’- `-o, --output <dir>`: Output directory for canonical YAML
+   806â†’- `--install`: Auto-install to DAW config directories
+   807â†’- `--dry-run`: Preview without deploying
+   808â†’
+   809â†’**Examples:**
+   810â†’\```bash
+   811â†’# Basic deployment
+   812â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour
+   813â†’
+   814â†’# Multiple DAWs
+   815â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live
+   816â†’
+   817â†’# With plugin context (enables AI matching)
+   818â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --daw ardour
+   819â†’
+   820â†’# Save canonical and install
+   821â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --output ./mappings --install
+   822â†’
+   823â†’# Preview only
+   824â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour --dry-run
+   825â†’\```

+   827â†’## Troubleshooting
+   828â†’
+   829â†’### Plugin Interrogation Issues
+   830â†’
+   831â†’**Problem:** Plugin crashes during scan
+   832â†’\```bash
+   833â†’# Skip problematic plugins by editing
+   834â†’modules/canonical-midi-maps/src/tools/batch-plugin-generator.ts
+   835â†’
+   836â†’const SKIP_PATTERNS = [
+   837â†’  /UAD/i,           # Universal Audio plugins
+   838â†’  /Waves/i,         # Waves plugins (if problematic)
+   839â†’  /YourPlugin/i     # Add problematic plugin
+   840â†’];
+   841â†’\```
+   842â†’
+   843â†’**Problem:** No parameters found
+   844â†’- Check plugin format (VST3 required)
+   845â†’- Verify plugin is installed correctly
+   846â†’- Try manual interrogation: `plughost --interrogate /path/to/plugin.vst3`
+   847â†’
+   848â†’### Canonical Mapping Issues
+   849â†’
+   850â†’**Problem:** Wrong parameter indices
+   851â†’- Verify plugin descriptor exists and is current
+   852â†’- Check parameter index in descriptor JSON
+   853â†’- Regenerate descriptor if plugin was updated
+   854â†’
+   855â†’**Problem:** YAML validation errors
+   856â†’- Check YAML syntax (indentation, colons, quotes)
+   857â†’- Verify required fields (version, device, plugin, controls)
+   858â†’- Use YAML validator: `npx js-yaml --validate mapping.yaml`
+   859â†’
+   860â†’### Fuzzy Matching Issues
+   861â†’
+   862â†’**Problem:** AI matching fails completely
+   863â†’- Verify `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` environment variable set
+   864â†’- Check `claude` CLI is installed: `which claude`
+   865â†’- Ensure plugin descriptor exists and is valid
+   866â†’- Check control names are descriptive (not "Knob1", "EncA")
+   867â†’
+   868â†’**Problem:** Low confidence matches (< 0.7)
+   869â†’- Use more specific control names on hardware
+   870â†’- Add semantic context ("VCF Cutoff" vs "Cutoff")
+   871â†’- Manually override in canonical YAML if needed
+   872â†’
+   873â†’**Problem:** Multiple parameters matched to same control
+   874â†’- Review match confidence scores in output
+   875â†’- Use most specific parameter name on hardware
+   876â†’- Manually specify correct parameter in YAML
+   877â†’
+   878â†’**Problem:** Rate limiting or API errors
+   879â†’- Batch controls in single request (default behavior)
+   880â†’- Add retry logic with exponential backoff
+   881â†’- Use cached results when available
+   882â†’
+   883â†’### Deployment Issues
+   884â†’
+   885â†’**Problem:** Ardour map not appearing
+   886â†’- Check installation path: `~/Library/Preferences/Ardour8/midi_maps/`
+   887â†’- Verify XML is valid: `xmllint --noout mapping.map`
+   888â†’- Restart Ardour after installation
+   889â†’
+   890â†’**Problem:** Live mapping not working
+   891â†’- Check `plugin-mappings.json` syntax
+   892â†’- Verify runtime-loader is loading file
+   893â†’- Check Max for Live device logs
+   894â†’- Ensure plugin name matches exactly
+   895â†’
+   896â†’**Problem:** Controller not detected
+   897â†’- Check MIDI connections (Web MIDI API requires Chrome/Edge)
+   898â†’- Verify controller is powered on
+   899â†’- Try manual adapter creation (bypass auto-detection)
+   900â†’
+   901â†’## Performance Tips
+   902â†’
+   903â†’### Cache Plugin Descriptors
+   904â†’
+   905â†’Plugin interrogation is cached for 24 hours. To force refresh:
+   906â†’\```bash
+   907â†’rm plugin-descriptors/plugins-catalog-batch.json
+   908â†’pnpm plugin:generate-batch
+   909â†’\```
+   910â†’
+   911â†’### Cache AI Matches
+   912â†’
+   913â†’AI matches are saved in canonical YAML for reuse:
+   914â†’\```bash
+   915â†’# First deployment: AI matching runs (~2-5 seconds)
+   916â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --output ./cache
+   917â†’
+   918â†’# Subsequent deployments: Reads from cached YAML (~instant)
+   919â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --input ./cache/lcxl3-jupiter8.yaml --daw ardour
+   920â†’\```
+   921â†’
+   922â†’### Batch Deployments
+   923â†’
+   924â†’Deploy multiple configurations in one script:
+   925â†’\```bash
+   926â†’#!/bin/bash
+   927â†’for slot in {0..3}; do
+   928â†’  npx controller-deploy deploy --slot $slot --daw ardour live --install
+   929â†’done
+   930â†’\```
+   931â†’
+   932â†’### Validate Before Deploy
+   933â†’
+   934â†’Use dry-run to verify before actual deployment:
+   935â†’\```bash
+   936â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live --dry-run
+   937â†’# Review output, then run without --dry-run
+   938â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live --install
+   939â†’\```

+# Feature 360 Architecture
+
+**Version:** 1.21
+**Status:** In Progress
+**Last Updated:** 2025-10-12
+
+## Overview
+
+The 360 feature implements a modular, extensible architecture for deploying MIDI controller configurations to multiple DAWs. The design follows interface-first principles with clear separation of concerns across four main layers:
+
+1. **Controller Abstraction Layer** - Hardware interrogation and configuration extraction
+2. **Canonical Conversion Layer** - Format translation to universal MIDI mappings
+3. **Parameter Matching Layer** - AI-powered fuzzy matching of control names to plugin parameters
+4. **DAW Deployment Layer** - Platform-specific map generation and installation
+
+## System Architecture
+

+## Core Components
+
+### 1. Controller-Workflow Module
+
+**Purpose:** Generic framework for controller â†’ DAW deployment
+
+**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/`
+
+**Key Abstractions:**
+
+\```typescript
+// Controller interrogation interface
+interface ControllerAdapterInterface {
+  connect(): Promise<void>;
+  listConfigurations(): Promise<ConfigurationSlot[]>;
+  readConfiguration(slot: number): Promise<ControllerConfiguration>;
+}
+
+// Canonical conversion interface
+interface CanonicalConverterInterface {
+  convert(config: ControllerConfiguration, options: ConversionOptions): CanonicalMidiMap;
+  canConvert(config: ControllerConfiguration): boolean;
+}
+
+// Parameter matching interface (NEW)
+interface ParameterMatcherInterface {
+  matchParameters(
+    controlNames: string[],
+    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor
+  ): Promise<ParameterMatch[]>;
+  getConfidence(match: ParameterMatch): number;
+}
+
+// DAW deployment interface
+interface DAWDeployerInterface {
+  deploy(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, options: DeploymentOptions): Promise<DeploymentResult>;
+  isInstalled(): Promise<boolean>;
+}
+\```
+
+**Design Principles:**
+- **Interface-first:** All adapters implement well-defined interfaces
+- **Dependency injection:** Components accept dependencies via constructor
+- **Factory pattern:** Auto-detection and instantiation via factories
+- **Event-driven:** Progress reporting via EventEmitter
+- **AI-augmented:** Optional Claude AI integration for parameter matching
+
+See [implementation/workplan.md](./implementation/workplan.md) for detailed design.
+
+### 2. Launch Control XL3 Adapter
+
+**Purpose:** Reference implementation for Novation Launch Control XL 3
+
+**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/adapters/controllers/LaunchControlXL3Adapter.ts`
+
+**Capabilities:**
+- Read all 16 custom mode slots
+- Extract control configurations (48 controls: 24 encoders, 8 sliders, 16 buttons)
+- Map LCXL3-specific IDs (SEND_A1, FADER1, etc.) to generic control types
+- Wrapper around existing launch-control-xl3 library
+
+**Control Mapping:**
+\```
+LCXL3 ID     â†’ Generic ID    â†’ MIDI CC

+SEND_A1      â†’ encoder_1     â†’ CC 13

+...

+
+### 3. Canonical MIDI Maps
+
+**Purpose:** Universal MIDI mapping format (DAW-agnostic)
+
+**Location:** `modules/canonical-midi-maps/`
+
+**Format:** YAML
+
+**Structure:**
+\```yaml
+version: 1.0.0
+
+device:
+  manufacturer: Novation
+  model: Launch Control XL 3
+
+plugin:
+  manufacturer: TAL Software
+  name: TAL-J-8
+  descriptor: plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json
+
+metadata:
+  name: Jupiter-8 Template
+  description: Controls for TAL-J-8 synth
+  date: 2025-10-12
+  aiMatchingEnabled: true  # NEW: Indicates fuzzy matching was used
+
+midi_channel: 1  # Global MIDI channel
+
+controls:
+  - id: encoder_1
+    name: VCF Cutoff
+    type: encoder
+    cc: 13
+    channel: 1
+    plugin_parameter: 105      # Added by AI matcher
+    match_confidence: 1.0       # NEW: Match quality
+    range: [0, 127]
+\```
+
+**Key Features:**
+- **Real parameter indices:** Uses plugin descriptors for accurate mappings
+- **Hardware abstraction:** Generic control IDs work across devices
+- **Plugin awareness:** Links to plugin descriptors for validation
+- **Metadata rich:** Version tracking, tags, creation dates
+- **AI-enhanced:** Optional fuzzy matching with confidence scores
+
+See [project ARCHITECTURE.md](../../ARCHITECTURE.md) for component relationships.
+

+
+**Key Capabilities:**
+
+1. **Semantic Matching**
+   - Exact matches: "VCF Cutoff" â†’ "VCF Cutoff"
+   - Abbreviations: "Filter Res" â†’ "VCF Resonance"
+   - Synonyms: "Env Attack" â†’ "Attack Time"
+   - Context-aware: Groups related parameters
+
+2. **Integration Methods**
+   - **Method 1:** Shell out to `claude` CLI
+   - **Method 2:** Direct Anthropic API calls
+   - **Method 3:** Cached results from previous matches
+
+3. **Confidence Scoring**
+   - 1.0: Exact string match
+   - 0.9-0.99: High confidence (clear synonym)
+   - 0.7-0.89: Medium confidence (abbreviation/context)
+   - < 0.7: Low confidence (ambiguous match)
+
+4. **Error Handling**
+   - Graceful degradation if AI unavailable
+   - Retry logic with exponential backoff
+   - Cache results for performance
+   - Manual override support
+
+**Interface:**
+
+\```typescript
+interface ParameterMatcherInterface {
+  /**
+   * Match control names to plugin parameters using AI
+   */
+  matchParameters(
+    controlNames: string[],
+    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor,
+    options?: MatchOptions
+  ): Promise<ParameterMatch[]>;
+
+  /**
+   * Get match confidence score (0-1)
+   */
+  getConfidence(match: ParameterMatch): number;
+
+  /**
+   * Check if matcher is available (API key configured)
+   */
+  isAvailable(): Promise<boolean>;
+}
+
+interface ParameterMatch {
+  controlName: string;
+  controlCC: number;
+  parameterIndex: number;
+  parameterName: string;
+  confidence: number;
+  matchType: 'exact' | 'abbreviation' | 'synonym' | 'context';
+}
+
+interface MatchOptions {
+  confidenceThreshold?: number;  // Default: 0.7
+  enableCaching?: boolean;        // Default: true
+  model?: string;                 // Default: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022'
+}
+\```
+
+**Example Usage:**
+
+\```typescript
+import { ParameterMatcher } from '@/services/ParameterMatcher';
+
+const matcher = new ParameterMatcher({
+  apiKey: process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY,
+  useCLI: true  // Prefer CLI if available
+});
+
+// Load plugin descriptor
+const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal-j-8');
+
+// Extract control names from hardware
+const controlNames = ['VCF Cutoff', 'Filter Res', 'Env Attack'];
+
+// Match parameters
+const matches = await matcher.matchParameters(controlNames, descriptor);
+
+// Apply matches to canonical map
+for (const match of matches) {
+  const control = canonicalMap.controls.find(c => c.name === match.controlName);
+  if (control && match.confidence >= 0.7) {
+    control.plugin_parameter = match.parameterIndex;
+    control.match_confidence = match.confidence;
+  }
+}
+\```
+
+**Performance:**
+- Single API call batches all controls
+- Results cached in canonical YAML
+- Typical matching time: 2-5 seconds
+- Subsequent deployments: instant (uses cache)
+
+**Dependencies:**
+- `@anthropic-ai/sdk` (API method)
+- `claude` CLI (optional, preferred method)
+- Plugin descriptor files (from Phase 1)

+## Extensibility
+
+### Adding a New Controller
+
+1. **Implement ControllerAdapter:**
+   \```typescript
+   export class NewControllerAdapter implements ControllerAdapterInterface {
+     // Implement all interface methods
+   }
+   \```
+
+2. **Implement CanonicalConverter:**
+   \```typescript
+   export class NewControllerConverter implements CanonicalConverterInterface {
+     convert(config: ControllerConfiguration, options: ConversionOptions): CanonicalMidiMap {
+       // Device-specific â†’ canonical mapping
+     }
+   }
+   \```
+
+3. **Register in Workflow:**
+   - Update `DeploymentWorkflow.detectController()`
+   - Update `DeploymentWorkflow.getConverterFor()`
+
+**No changes required:** Orchestrator, CLI, DAW deployers, and AI matcher all work generically.
+
+### Adding a New DAW
+
+1. **Implement DAWDeployer:**
+   \```typescript
+   export class NewDAWDeployer implements DAWDeployerInterface {
+     async deploy(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, options: DeploymentOptions): Promise<DeploymentResult> {
+       // Generate DAW-specific format
+       // AI-matched plugin_parameter fields available in canonicalMap
+     }
+   }
+   \```
+
+2. **Register in Workflow:**
+   - Update `DeploymentWorkflow.create()` to include new deployer
+
+**No changes required:** Controller adapters, converters, orchestrator, and AI matcher all work generically.

+## Design Patterns
+
+### Interface-First Design
+
+All major components define interfaces before implementation:
+- Enables testing with mocks
+- Clear contracts between layers
+- Easier to extend and maintain
+- AI matcher is optional dependency
+
+### Dependency Injection
+
+\```typescript
+export class DeploymentWorkflow {
+  constructor(
+    private controllerAdapter: ControllerAdapterInterface,
+    private converter: CanonicalConverterInterface,
+    private parameterMatcher: ParameterMatcherInterface,  // NEW
+    private deployers: Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>
+  ) {}
+}
+\```
+
+Benefits:
+- Testable (inject mocks)
+- Flexible (swap implementations)
+- Follows project guidelines
+- AI matcher can be replaced or disabled
+
+### Factory Pattern
+
+\```typescript
+static async create(options: CreateOptions): Promise<DeploymentWorkflow> {
+  const adapter = options.controllerAdapter || await this.detectController();
+  const converter = this.getConverterFor(adapter);
+  const matcher = options.enableAIMatching
+    ? new ParameterMatcher()
+    : new NoOpMatcher();  // Graceful degradation
+  const deployers = new Map();
+  // ...
+  return new DeploymentWorkflow(adapter, converter, matcher, deployers);
+}
+\```
+
+Benefits:
+- Auto-detection of hardware
+- Simplified instantiation
+- Encapsulates complexity
+- Optional AI matching
+
+### Event-Driven Progress
+
+\```typescript
+workflow.on('progress', ({ step, message }) => {
+  console.log(`[${step}/4] ${message}`);  // Updated for AI matching step
+});
+
+workflow.on('ai-matching', ({ controlCount, duration }) => {
+  console.log(`AI matched ${controlCount} parameters in ${duration}ms`);
+});
+
+workflow.on('canonical-saved', ({ path }) => {
+  console.log(`Saved: ${path}`);
+});
+\```
+
+Benefits:
+- Real-time feedback
+- Decoupled UI/logging
+- Extensible event system
+- AI matching progress visibility
+
+## Performance Considerations
+
+### Target Metrics
+
+| Operation | Target | Current Status |
+|-----------|--------|----------------|
+| Controller read | <2s | âœ… Sub-second |
+| Canonical conversion | <100ms | â³ Not measured |
+| AI parameter matching | <5s | â³ In progress |
+| Ardour XML generation | <50ms | â³ Not measured |
+| Live JSON write | <20ms | âœ… Instant |
+| End-to-end workflow | <10s | â³ Not measured (~6s with AI) |
+
+### Optimization Strategies
+
+- **Caching:** Controller configurations cached between deployments
+- **AI result caching:** Matched parameters saved in canonical YAML
+- **Batch matching:** All controls matched in single API call
+- **Lazy loading:** DAW deployers loaded on-demand
+- **Async operations:** Non-blocking I/O for file operations
+- **Streaming:** Large maps processed in chunks
+- **Graceful degradation:** Falls back to generic mappings if AI unavailable
+
+## Security Considerations
+
+- **File system access:** Validates output paths before writing
+- **MIDI input:** Validates SysEx messages before parsing
+- **API keys:** Secure storage and environment variable handling
+- **Command injection:** No shell command execution except trusted `claude` CLI
+- **Path traversal:** Sanitizes file paths in output directory options
+- **AI prompts:** Input validation to prevent prompt injection
+- **Rate limiting:** Respects Anthropic API rate limits

+   240â†’**Key Capabilities:**

+   242â†’1. **Semantic Matching**
+   243â†’   - Exact matches: "VCF Cutoff" â†’ "VCF Cutoff"
+   244â†’   - Abbreviations: "Filter Res" â†’ "VCF Resonance"
+   245â†’   - Synonyms: "Env Attack" â†’ "Attack Time"
+   246â†’   - Context-aware: Groups related parameters
+   247â†’
+   248â†’2. **Integration Methods**
+   249â†’   - **Method 1:** Shell out to `claude` CLI
+   250â†’   - **Method 2:** Direct Anthropic API calls
+   251â†’   - **Method 3:** Cached results from previous matches
+   252â†’
+   253â†’3. **Confidence Scoring**
+   254â†’   - 1.0: Exact string match
+   255â†’   - 0.9-0.99: High confidence (clear synonym)
+   256â†’   - 0.7-0.89: Medium confidence (abbreviation/context)
+   257â†’   - < 0.7: Low confidence (ambiguous match)
+   258â†’
+   259â†’4. **Error Handling**
+   260â†’   - Graceful degradation if AI unavailable
+   261â†’   - Retry logic with exponential backoff
+   262â†’   - Cache results for performance
+   263â†’   - Manual override support

+   265â†’**Interface:**

+   281â†’  getConfidence(match: ParameterMatch): number;
+   282â†’

+   305â†’**Example Usage:**

+   307â†’\```typescript

+   309â†’
+   310â†’const matcher = new ParameterMatcher({

+   315â†’// Load plugin descriptor

+   551â†’## Design Patterns
+   552â†’
+   553â†’### Interface-First Design
+   554â†’
+   555â†’All major components define interfaces before implementation:
+   556â†’- Enables testing with mocks
+   557â†’- Clear contracts between layers
+   558â†’- Easier to extend and maintain
+   559â†’- AI matcher is optional dependency
+   560â†’
+   561â†’### Dependency Injection
+   562â†’
+   563â†’\```typescript
+   564â†’export class DeploymentWorkflow {
+   565â†’  constructor(
+   566â†’    private controllerAdapter: ControllerAdapterInterface,
+   567â†’    private converter: CanonicalConverterInterface,
+   568â†’    private parameterMatcher: ParameterMatcherInterface,  // NEW
+   569â†’    private deployers: Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>
+   570â†’  ) {}
+   571â†’}
+   572â†’\```
+   573â†’
+   574â†’Benefits:
+   575â†’- Testable (inject mocks)
+   576â†’- Flexible (swap implementations)
+   577â†’- Follows project guidelines
+   578â†’- AI matcher can be replaced or disabled
+   579â†’
+   580â†’### Factory Pattern
+   581â†’
+   582â†’\```typescript
+   583â†’static async create(options: CreateOptions): Promise<DeploymentWorkflow> {
+   584â†’  const adapter = options.controllerAdapter || await this.detectController();
+   585â†’  const converter = this.getConverterFor(adapter);
+   586â†’  const matcher = options.enableAIMatching
+   587â†’    ? new ParameterMatcher()
+   588â†’    : new NoOpMatcher();  // Graceful degradation
+   589â†’  const deployers = new Map();
+   590â†’  // ...
+   591â†’  return new DeploymentWorkflow(adapter, converter, matcher, deployers);
+   592â†’}
+   593â†’\```
+   594â†’
+   595â†’Benefits:
+   596â†’- Auto-detection of hardware
+   597â†’- Simplified instantiation
+   598â†’- Encapsulates complexity
+   599â†’- Optional AI matching
+   600â†’
+   601â†’### Event-Driven Progress
+   602â†’
+   603â†’\```typescript
+   604â†’workflow.on('progress', ({ step, message }) => {
+   605â†’  console.log(`[${step}/4] ${message}`);  // Updated for AI matching step
+   606â†’});
+   607â†’
+   608â†’workflow.on('ai-matching', ({ controlCount, duration }) => {
+   609â†’  console.log(`AI matched ${controlCount} parameters in ${duration}ms`);
+   610â†’});
+   611â†’
+   612â†’workflow.on('canonical-saved', ({ path }) => {
+   613â†’  console.log(`Saved: ${path}`);
+   614â†’});
+   615â†’\```
+   616â†’
+   617â†’Benefits:
+   618â†’- Real-time feedback
+   619â†’- Decoupled UI/logging
+   620â†’- Extensible event system
+   621â†’- AI matching progress visibility
+   622â†’
+   623â†’## Performance Considerations
+   624â†’
+   625â†’### Target Metrics
+   626â†’
+   627â†’| Operation | Target | Current Status |
+   628â†’|-----------|--------|----------------|
+   629â†’| Controller read | <2s | âœ… Sub-second |
+   630â†’| Canonical conversion | <100ms | â³ Not measured |
+   631â†’| AI parameter matching | <5s | â³ In progress |
+   632â†’| Ardour XML generation | <50ms | â³ Not measured |
+   633â†’| Live JSON write | <20ms | âœ… Instant |
+   634â†’| End-to-end workflow | <10s | â³ Not measured (~6s with AI) |
+   635â†’
+   636â†’### Optimization Strategies
+   637â†’
+   638â†’- **Caching:** Controller configurations cached between deployments
+   639â†’- **AI result caching:** Matched parameters saved in canonical YAML
+   640â†’- **Batch matching:** All controls matched in single API call
+   641â†’- **Lazy loading:** DAW deployers loaded on-demand
+   642â†’- **Async operations:** Non-blocking I/O for file operations
+   643â†’- **Streaming:** Large maps processed in chunks
+   644â†’- **Graceful degradation:** Falls back to generic mappings if AI unavailable
+   645â†’
+   646â†’## Security Considerations
+   647â†’
+   648â†’- **File system access:** Validates output paths before writing
+   649â†’- **MIDI input:** Validates SysEx messages before parsing
+   650â†’- **API keys:** Secure storage and environment variable handling
+   651â†’- **Command injection:** No shell command execution except trusted `claude` CLI
+   652â†’- **Path traversal:** Sanitizes file paths in output directory options
+   653â†’- **AI prompts:** Input validation to prevent prompt injection
+   654â†’- **Rate limiting:** Respects Anthropic API rate limits

+```md
+# Controller Workflow Services
+
+Intelligent services for controller configuration and plugin mapping.
+
+## ParameterMatcher
+
+The `ParameterMatcher` service uses Claude AI to intelligently match hardware controller control names to plugin parameters based on semantic similarity, common naming conventions, and audio engineering domain knowledge.
+
+### Features
+
+- **AI-Powered Matching**: Uses Claude 3.5 Sonnet for intelligent parameter matching
+- **Flexible Integration**: Supports both Anthropic API and Claude CLI
+- **Confidence Scoring**: Provides 0-1 confidence scores for each match
+- **Semantic Understanding**: Recognizes common abbreviations and synonyms
+- **Plugin Descriptor Support**: Works with the canonical-midi-maps plugin descriptor registry
+
+### Basic Usage
+
+\```typescript
+import { ParameterMatcher, loadPluginDescriptor } from '@oletizi/controller-workflow';
+
+// Load plugin descriptor
+const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal-j-8');
+
+// Create matcher instance
+const matcher = ParameterMatcher.create({
+  minConfidence: 0.6,  // Minimum confidence threshold
+  timeout: 30000,      // 30 second timeout
+});
+
+// Match control names to parameters
+const hardwareControls = ['Cutoff', 'Resonance', 'Attack', 'Release'];
+const results = await matcher.matchParameters(hardwareControls, descriptor);
+
+// Process results
+for (const result of results) {
+  if (result.pluginParameter !== undefined) {
+    console.log(`${result.controlName} â†’ ${result.parameterName}`);
+    console.log(`  Confidence: ${result.confidence}`);
+    console.log(`  Parameter Index: ${result.pluginParameter}`);
+  }
+}
+\```
+
+### Configuration
+
+#### API vs CLI
+
+The matcher supports two Claude integration methods:
+
+1. **Anthropic API** (recommended):
+   \```bash
+   export ANTHROPIC_API_KEY="your-api-key"
+   \```
+
+2. **Claude CLI** (fallback):
+   \```bash
+   npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude
+   claude auth
+   \```
+
+If `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` is set, the API will be used. Otherwise, it falls back to the CLI.
+
+#### Match Options
+
+\```typescript
+interface MatchOptions {
+  minConfidence?: number;        // 0-1, default 0.5
+  preserveControlNames?: boolean; // Preserve original names
+  customPrompt?: string;         // Custom system prompt
+  timeout?: number;              // Request timeout in ms
+}
+\```
+
+### Advanced Usage
+
+#### Custom Prompts
+
+You can provide a custom system prompt to guide matching behavior:
+
+\```typescript
+const results = await matcher.matchParameters(controls, descriptor, {
+  customPrompt: `You are an expert at mapping MIDI controls to synthesizer parameters.
+Focus on common synthesizer workflows and standard naming conventions.
+Consider these priority mappings:
+- Cutoff â†’ Filter Frequency
+- Res â†’ Filter Resonance
+- Atk â†’ Envelope Attack
+...`
+});
+\```
+
+#### Filtering by Confidence
+
+\```typescript
+const highConfidenceMatches = results.filter(r => r.confidence >= 0.8);
+const unknownControls = results.filter(r => r.pluginParameter === undefined);
+\```
+
+#### Integration with Deployment Workflow
+
+\```typescript
+// Match parameters
+const matches = await matcher.matchParameters(controlNames, descriptor);
+
+// Add to canonical map
+const canonicalMap = {
+  name: 'My Controller',
+  plugin: descriptor.plugin,
+  bindings: matches.map((match, index) => ({
+    control: match.controlName,
+    cc: index + 1,
+    parameter: match.pluginParameter,
+    name: match.parameterName,
+  })),
+};
+\```
+
+### Plugin Descriptor Loading
+
+The `loadPluginDescriptor` function loads plugin descriptors from the canonical-midi-maps registry:
+
+\```typescript
+// By plugin name (case-insensitive, space-insensitive)
+const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('TAL-J-8');
+const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal j 8');
+const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8');
+
+// All normalize to the same descriptor file
+\```
+
+### Error Handling
+
+\```typescript
+try {
+  const results = await matcher.matchParameters(controls, descriptor);
+} catch (error) {
+  if (error.message.includes('API request failed')) {
+    // Handle API errors (rate limits, auth, etc.)
+  } else if (error.message.includes('timeout')) {
+    // Handle timeout
+  } else if (error.message.includes('Plugin descriptor not found')) {
+    // Handle missing plugin descriptor
+  }
+}
+\```
+
+### Performance Considerations
+
+- **API Response Time**: Typical 2-5 seconds for 10-20 controls
+- **Rate Limits**: Anthropic API has rate limits; consider caching results
+- **Batch Processing**: Process multiple controllers sequentially to avoid rate limits
+- **Timeouts**: Default 30s should handle most plugins; increase for large plugins (>500 params)
+
+### Examples
+
+See `/examples/parameter-matching-example.ts` for a complete working example.
+
+### Testing
+
+Unit tests use mocked Claude responses to avoid API calls:
+
+\```typescript
+import { ParameterMatcher } from '@oletizi/controller-workflow';
+import { vi } from 'vitest';
+
+// Mock API response
+global.fetch = vi.fn().mockResolvedValue({
+  ok: true,
+  json: async () => ({
+    content: [{ type: 'text', text: JSON.stringify([/* mock matches */]) }],
+  }),
+});
+
+process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY = 'test-key';
+const results = await matcher.matchParameters(controls, descriptor);
+\```
+
+### Architecture
+
+The ParameterMatcher follows interface-first design:
+
+- **Interface**: `ParameterMatcherInterface` - contract for matching implementations
+- **Implementation**: `ParameterMatcher` - Claude AI-based implementation
+- **Factory Pattern**: `ParameterMatcher.create()` for dependency injection
+- **Composition**: No inheritance, uses functional composition
+
+### Future Enhancements
+
+- Rule-based fallback matcher for offline usage
+- Caching layer for common plugin/control combinations
+- Learning from user corrections
+- Support for multi-plugin scenarios
+- Parameter group awareness (envelope, filter, oscillator)
+
+```

+// After line 175 (after reading controller config)

+// Step 1.5: AI-powered parameter matching (if plugin specified)
+if (options.plugin) {
+  try {
+    emitProgress({ step: 1.5, total: 3, message: 'AI-matching control names to plugin parameters...' });
+    
+    const { ParameterMatcher, loadPluginDescriptor } = await import('../services/ParameterMatcher.js');
+    
+    // Load plugin descriptor
+    const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor(options.plugin);
+    console.log(`     âœ“ Loaded plugin descriptor: ${descriptor.plugin.name} (${descriptor.parameters.length} parameters)`);
+    
+    // Extract control names
+    const controlNames = config.controls
+      .filter(c => c.name && c.name.trim().length > 0)
+      .map(c => c.name!);
+    
+    if (controlNames.length === 0) {
+      console.log('     âš  No named controls found, skipping AI matching');
+    } else {
+      // Match parameters
+      const matcher = ParameterMatcher.create({ minConfidence: 0.6 });
+      const matches = await matcher.matchParameters(controlNames, descriptor);
+      
+      // Add plugin_parameter to controls
+      let matchCount = 0;
+      config.controls.forEach((control) => {
+        if (!control.name) return;
+        
+        const match = matches.find(m => m.controlName === control.name);
+        if (match?.pluginParameter !== undefined) {
+          control.plugin_parameter = match.pluginParameter;
+          matchCount++;
+        }
+      });
+      
+      console.log(`     âœ“ AI-matched ${matchCount}/${controlNames.length} controls (${((matchCount/controlNames.length)*100).toFixed(0)}%)`);
+      
+      // Show low confidence warnings
+      const lowConfidence = matches.filter(m => m.confidence < 0.7 && m.pluginParameter !== undefined);
+      if (lowConfidence.length > 0) {
+        console.log(`     âš  ${lowConfidence.length} matches with confidence < 0.7:`);
+        lowConfidence.forEach(m => {

+        });
+      }
+    }
+  } catch (error: unknown) {
+    const errorMessage = error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error);
+    console.log(`     âš  AI matching failed: ${errorMessage}`);
+    console.log('     â„¹ Continuing without parameter matching...');
+    // Don't fail deployment if AI matching fails
+  }
+  console.log('');
+}
