+   337â†’## Phase 3: Launch Control XL3 Converter
+   338â†’
+   339â†’**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/converters/LaunchControlXL3Converter.ts`
+   340â†’
+   341â†’\```typescript
+   342â†’export class LaunchControlXL3Converter implements CanonicalConverterInterface {
+   343â†’
+   344â†’  getConverterInfo(): ConverterInfo {
+   345â†’    return {
+   346â†’      supportedController: 'Novation Launch Control XL 3',
+   347â†’      version: '1.0.0',
+   348â†’      features: ['custom-modes', 'label-preservation', 'all-control-types']
+   349â†’    };
+   350â†’  }
+   351â†’
+   352â†’  canConvert(config: ControllerConfiguration): boolean {
+   353â†’    // Validate config has required LCXL3 structure
+   354â†’    return config.controls.length > 0 &&
+   355â†’           config.controls.every(c => c.cc !== undefined);
+   356â†’  }
+   357â†’
+   358â†’  convert(
+   359â†’    config: ControllerConfiguration,
+   360â†’    options: ConversionOptions
+   361â†’  ): CanonicalMidiMap {
+   362â†’    return {
+   363â†’      version: '1.0.0',
+   364â†’      device: {
+   365â†’        manufacturer: 'Novation',
+   366â†’        model: 'Launch Control XL 3',
+   367â†’        ...(options.deviceOverrides || {})
+   368â†’      },
+   369â†’      metadata: {
+   370â†’        name: config.name,
+   371â†’        description: `Converted from LCXL3 custom mode: ${config.name}`,
+   372â†’        date: new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0],
+   373â†’        tags: ['launch-control-xl3', 'auto-generated']
+   374â†’      },
+   375â†’      plugin: options.pluginInfo,
+   376â†’      midi_channel: options.midiChannel,
+   377â†’      controls: this.mapControls(config.controls, options)
+   378â†’    };
+   379â†’  }
+   380â†’
+   381â†’  private mapControls(controls: ControlMapping[], options: ConversionOptions): ControlDefinition[] {
+   382â†’    return controls.map(control => ({
+   383â†’      id: this.mapControlId(control.id),        // SEND_A1 â†’ encoder_1
+   384â†’      name: options.preserveLabels ? control.name : this.getDefaultName(control.id),
+   385â†’      type: this.mapControlType(control.type),
+   386â†’      cc: control.cc!,
+   387â†’      channel: control.channel ?? options.midiChannel ?? 0,
+   388â†’      range: control.range || [0, 127],
+   389â†’      description: `Mapped from ${control.id}`
+   390â†’    }));
+   391â†’  }
+   392â†’
+   393â†’  private mapControlId(lcxl3Id: string): string {
+   394â†’    // LCXL3-specific mapping: SEND_A1 â†’ encoder_1, FADER1 â†’ slider_1, etc.
+   395â†’    const mapping: Record<string, string> = {
+   396â†’      'SEND_A1': 'encoder_1', 'SEND_A2': 'encoder_2', 'SEND_A3': 'encoder_3',
+   397â†’      'SEND_A4': 'encoder_4', 'SEND_A5': 'encoder_5', 'SEND_A6': 'encoder_6',
+   398â†’      'SEND_A7': 'encoder_7', 'SEND_A8': 'encoder_8',
+   399â†’      'SEND_B1': 'encoder_9', 'SEND_B2': 'encoder_10', 'SEND_B3': 'encoder_11',
+   400â†’      'SEND_B4': 'encoder_12', 'SEND_B5': 'encoder_13', 'SEND_B6': 'encoder_14',
+   401â†’      'SEND_B7': 'encoder_15', 'SEND_B8': 'encoder_16',
+   402â†’      'PAN1': 'encoder_17', 'PAN2': 'encoder_18', 'PAN3': 'encoder_19',
+   403â†’      'PAN4': 'encoder_20', 'PAN5': 'encoder_21', 'PAN6': 'encoder_22',
+   404â†’      'PAN7': 'encoder_23', 'PAN8': 'encoder_24',
+   405â†’      'FADER1': 'slider_1', 'FADER2': 'slider_2', 'FADER3': 'slider_3',
+   406â†’      'FADER4': 'slider_4', 'FADER5': 'slider_5', 'FADER6': 'slider_6',
+   407â†’      'FADER7': 'slider_7', 'FADER8': 'slider_8',
+   408â†’      'FOCUS1': 'button_1', 'FOCUS2': 'button_2', 'FOCUS3': 'button_3',
+   409â†’      'FOCUS4': 'button_4', 'FOCUS5': 'button_5', 'FOCUS6': 'button_6',
+   410â†’      'FOCUS7': 'button_7', 'FOCUS8': 'button_8',
+   411â†’      'CONTROL1': 'button_9', 'CONTROL2': 'button_10', 'CONTROL3': 'button_11',
+   412â†’      'CONTROL4': 'button_12', 'CONTROL5': 'button_13', 'CONTROL6': 'button_14',
+   413â†’      'CONTROL7': 'button_15', 'CONTROL8': 'button_16'
+   414â†’    };
+   415â†’    return mapping[lcxl3Id] || lcxl3Id.toLowerCase();
+   416â†’  }
+   417â†’
+   418â†’  private mapControlType(type: ControlType): 'encoder' | 'slider' | 'button' | 'button_group' {
+   419â†’    return type;
+   420â†’  }
+   421â†’
+   422â†’  private getDefaultName(controlId: string): string {
+   423â†’    return controlId.replace(/_/g, ' ').replace(/\b\w/g, l => l.toUpperCase());
+   424â†’  }
+   425â†’}

+   437â†’## Phase 4: Generalized Deployment Workflow
+   438â†’
+   439â†’**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/orchestrator/DeploymentWorkflow.ts`
+   440â†’
+   441â†’\```typescript
+   442â†’import { EventEmitter } from 'eventemitter3';
+   443â†’
+   444â†’export interface WorkflowOptions {
+   445â†’  configSlot: number;
+   446â†’  targets: string[];
+   447â†’  pluginInfo?: PluginDefinition;
+   448â†’  midiChannel?: number;
+   449â†’  preserveLabels?: boolean;
+   450â†’  outputDir?: string;
+   451â†’  autoInstall?: boolean;
+   452â†’  dryRun?: boolean;
+   453â†’}
+   454â†’
+   455â†’export interface WorkflowResult {
+   456â†’  success: boolean;
+   457â†’  controllerConfig?: ControllerConfiguration;
+   458â†’  canonicalMap?: CanonicalMidiMap;
+   459â†’  deployments: DeploymentResult[];
+   460â†’  errors: string[];
+   461â†’}
+   462â†’
+   463â†’export interface CreateOptions {
+   464â†’  controllerAdapter?: ControllerAdapterInterface;
+   465â†’  targets: string[];
+   466â†’}
+   467â†’
+   468â†’export class DeploymentWorkflow extends EventEmitter {
+   469â†’  constructor(
+   470â†’    private controllerAdapter: ControllerAdapterInterface,
+   471â†’    private converter: CanonicalConverterInterface,
+   472â†’    private deployers: Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>
+   473â†’  ) {
+   474â†’    super();
+   475â†’  }
+   476â†’
+   477â†’  static async create(options: CreateOptions): Promise<DeploymentWorkflow> {
+   478â†’    // Auto-detect controller or use specified adapter
+   479â†’    const adapter = options.controllerAdapter || await this.detectController();
+   480â†’
+   481â†’    // Get appropriate converter for detected controller
+   482â†’    const converter = this.getConverterFor(adapter);
+   483â†’
+   484â†’    // Initialize DAW deployers
+   485â†’    const deployers = new Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>();
+   486â†’    if (options.targets.includes('ardour')) {
+   487â†’      const { ArdourDeployer } = await import('../adapters/daws/ArdourDeployer.js');
+   488â†’      deployers.set('ardour', new ArdourDeployer());
+   489â†’    }
+   490â†’    if (options.targets.includes('live')) {
+   491â†’      const { LiveDeployer } = await import('../adapters/daws/LiveDeployer.js');
+   492â†’      deployers.set('live', new LiveDeployer());
+   493â†’    }
+   494â†’
+   495â†’    return new DeploymentWorkflow(adapter, converter, deployers);
+   496â†’  }
+   497â†’
+   498â†’  async execute(options: WorkflowOptions): Promise<WorkflowResult> {
+   499â†’    const errors: string[] = [];
+   500â†’
+   501â†’    try {
+   502â†’      // Step 1: Read configuration from controller
+   503â†’      this.emit('progress', { step: 1, message: 'Reading controller configuration...' });
+   504â†’      const config = await this.controllerAdapter.readConfiguration(options.configSlot);
+   505â†’
+   506â†’      // Step 2: Convert to canonical format
+   507â†’      this.emit('progress', { step: 2, message: 'Converting to canonical format...' });
+   508â†’      const canonicalMap = this.converter.convert(config, {
+   509â†’        pluginInfo: options.pluginInfo,
+   510â†’        midiChannel: options.midiChannel,
+   511â†’        preserveLabels: options.preserveLabels ?? true
+   512â†’      });
+   513â†’
+   514â†’      // Step 3: Save canonical YAML (optional)
+   515â†’      if (options.outputDir) {
+   516â†’        await this.saveCanonical(canonicalMap, options.outputDir);
+   517â†’      }
+   518â†’
+   519â†’      // Step 4: Deploy to each target DAW
+   520â†’      this.emit('progress', { step: 3, message: 'Deploying to DAWs...' });
+   521â†’      const deployments: DeploymentResult[] = [];
+   522â†’
+   523â†’      for (const target of options.targets) {
+   524â†’        const deployer = this.deployers.get(target);
+   525â†’        if (deployer) {
+   526â†’          const result = await deployer.deploy(canonicalMap, {
+   527â†’            autoInstall: options.autoInstall,
+   528â†’            dryRun: options.dryRun
+   529â†’          });
+   530â†’          deployments.push(result);
+   531â†’          if (!result.success) {
+   532â†’            errors.push(...(result.errors || [`${target} deployment failed`]));
+   533â†’          }
+   534â†’        } else {
+   535â†’          errors.push(`No deployer available for ${target}`);
+   536â†’        }
+   537â†’      }
+   538â†’
+   539â†’      return {
+   540â†’        success: deployments.every(d => d.success) && errors.length === 0,
+   541â†’        controllerConfig: config,
+   542â†’        canonicalMap,
+   543â†’        deployments,
+   544â†’        errors
+   545â†’      };
+   546â†’
+   547â†’    } catch (error) {
+   548â†’      errors.push(error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error));
+   549â†’      return {
+   550â†’        success: false,
+   551â†’        deployments: [],
+   552â†’        errors
+   553â†’      };
+   554â†’    }
+   555â†’  }
+   556â†’
+   557â†’  getControllerAdapter(): ControllerAdapterInterface {
+   558â†’    return this.controllerAdapter;
+   559â†’  }
+   560â†’
+   561â†’  private async saveCanonical(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, outputDir: string): Promise<void> {
+   562â†’    const yaml = await import('yaml');
+   563â†’    const { writeFileSync, mkdirSync } = await import('fs');
+   564â†’    const { join } = await import('path');
+   565â†’
+   566â†’    mkdirSync(outputDir, { recursive: true });
+   567â†’    const filename = `${canonicalMap.device.model.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-')}-${canonicalMap.metadata.name.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-')}.yaml`;
+   568â†’    const filepath = join(outputDir, filename);
+   569â†’
+   570â†’    writeFileSync(filepath, yaml.stringify(canonicalMap));
+   571â†’    this.emit('canonical-saved', { path: filepath });
+   572â†’  }
+   573â†’
+   574â†’  private static async detectController(): Promise<ControllerAdapterInterface> {
+   575â†’    // Try to detect connected controller
+   576â†’    // Start with LCXL3, add more controllers later
+   577â†’    try {
+   578â†’      const { LaunchControlXL3Adapter } = await import('../adapters/controllers/LaunchControlXL3Adapter.js');
+   579â†’      return await LaunchControlXL3Adapter.create();
+   580â†’    } catch {
+   581â†’      throw new Error('No supported controller detected');
+   582â†’    }
+   583â†’  }
+   584â†’
+   585â†’  private static getConverterFor(adapter: ControllerAdapterInterface): CanonicalConverterInterface {
+   586â†’    // Registry of converters by controller model
+   587â†’    if (adapter.model === 'Launch Control XL 3') {
+   588â†’      const { LaunchControlXL3Converter } = require('../converters/LaunchControlXL3Converter.js');
+   589â†’      return new LaunchControlXL3Converter();
+   590â†’    }
+   591â†’    throw new Error(`No converter available for ${adapter.model}`);
+   592â†’  }
+   593â†’}
+   594â†’\```
+   595â†’
+   596â†’**Acceptance Criteria - Phase 4:**
+   597â†’- âœ… Works with any ControllerAdapterInterface
+   598â†’- âœ… Auto-detects connected controller
+   599â†’- âœ… Supports multiple DAW targets simultaneously
+   600â†’- âœ… Event-based progress reporting
+   601â†’- âœ… Comprehensive error handling

+   727â†’### Ardour Deployer

+   729â†’**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/adapters/daws/ArdourDeployer.ts`

+   731â†’\```typescript
+   732â†’import { MidiMapBuilder, ArdourXMLSerializer } from '@oletizi/ardour-midi-maps';
+   733â†’
+   734â†’export class ArdourDeployer implements DAWDeployerInterface {

+   737â†’
+   738â†’  async deploy(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, options: DeploymentOptions): Promise<DeploymentResult> {
+   739â†’    try {
+   740â†’      // Convert canonical â†’ Ardour XML

+   750â†’        const { dirname } = await import('path');
+   751â†’
+   752â†’        mkdirSync(dirname(outputPath), { recursive: true });
+   753â†’        writeFileSync(outputPath, xml);
+   754â†’
+   755â†’        // Install to Ardour config if requested
+   756â†’        if (options.autoInstall) {

+   758â†’          const { basename, join } = await import('path');

+   767â†’        }
+   768â†’      }
+   769â†’
+   770â†’      return {
+   771â†’        success: true,
+   772â†’        dawName: this.dawName,
+   773â†’        outputPath,
+   774â†’        installed: false
+   775â†’      };
+   776â†’
+   777â†’    } catch (error) {
+   778â†’      return {
+   779â†’        success: false,
+   780â†’        dawName: this.dawName,
+   781â†’        errors: [error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)]
+   782â†’      };
+   783â†’    }
+   784â†’  }
+   785â†’
+   786â†’  async isInstalled(): Promise<boolean> {

+   788â†’    try {

+   790â†’      return existsSync(configDir);

+   793â†’    }
+   794â†’  }
+   795â†’
+   796â†’  async getConfigDirectory(): Promise<string> {
+   797â†’    const { homedir } = await import('os');
+   798â†’    const { join } = await import('path');
+   799â†’    const home = homedir();
+   800â†’
+   801â†’    switch (process.platform) {
+   802â†’      case 'darwin':
+   803â†’        return join(home, 'Library', 'Preferences', 'Ardour8', 'midi_maps');
+   804â†’      case 'linux':
+   805â†’        return join(home, '.config', 'ardour8', 'midi_maps');
+   806â†’      case 'win32':
+   807â†’        return join(home, 'AppData', 'Local', 'Ardour8', 'midi_maps');
+   808â†’      default:
+   809â†’        throw new Error(`Unsupported platform: ${process.platform}`);
+   810â†’    }
+   811â†’  }
+   812â†’
+   813â†’  private convertToArdour(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap): any {
+   814â†’    // Use existing ardour-midi-maps conversion logic
+   815â†’    const builder = new MidiMapBuilder({
+   816â†’      name: `${canonicalMap.device.manufacturer} ${canonicalMap.device.model}`,
+   817â†’      version: canonicalMap.version
+   818â†’    });
+   819â†’
+   820â†’    // Convert controls
+   821â†’    for (const control of canonicalMap.controls) {
+   822â†’      if (control.type === 'button') {
+   823â†’        builder.addNoteBinding({
+   824â†’          channel: control.channel as number,
+   825â†’          note: control.cc!,
+   826â†’          function: control.plugin_parameter ?
+   827â†’            `/route/plugin/parameter S1 1 ${control.plugin_parameter}` :
+   828â†’            'transport-stop'
+   829â†’        });
+   830â†’      } else {
+   831â†’        builder.addCCBinding({
+   832â†’          channel: control.channel as number,
+   833â†’          controller: control.cc!,
+   834â†’          function: control.plugin_parameter ?
+   835â†’            `/route/plugin/parameter S1 1 ${control.plugin_parameter}` :
+   836â†’            'track-set-gain[1]',
+   837â†’          encoder: control.type === 'encoder'
+   838â†’        });
+   839â†’      }
+   840â†’    }
+   841â†’
+   842â†’    return builder.build();
+   843â†’  }
+   844â†’
+   845â†’  private async getDefaultOutputPath(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap): Promise<string> {
+   846â†’    const { join } = await import('path');
+   847â†’    const filename = `${canonicalMap.device.manufacturer.toLowerCase()}-${canonicalMap.device.model.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-')}.map`;
+   848â†’    return join(process.cwd(), 'dist', 'ardour-maps', filename);
+   849â†’  }
+   850â†’}

+ * \```typescript

+ * sanitizeFilename("Test-Mode")     // returns "test-mode"
+ * \```

+function sanitizeFilename(name: string): string {

+ */
+function capitalize(str: string): string {

+

+}
+

+## Phase 2: Launch Control XL3 Adapter (Reference Implementation)
+
+**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/adapters/controllers/LaunchControlXL3Adapter.ts`
+
+\```typescript
+import { LaunchControlXL3 } from '@oletizi/launch-control-xl3';
+import type { ControllerAdapterInterface } from '../../core/ControllerAdapter.js';
+
+export class LaunchControlXL3Adapter implements ControllerAdapterInterface {
+  readonly manufacturer = 'Novation';
+  readonly model = 'Launch Control XL 3';
+  readonly capabilities = {
+    supportsCustomModes: true,
+    maxConfigSlots: 16,
+    supportsRead: true,
+    supportsWrite: true,
+    supportedControlTypes: ['encoder', 'slider', 'button'] as ControlType[]
+  };
+
+  constructor(private device: LaunchControlXL3) {}
+
+  static async create(): Promise<LaunchControlXL3Adapter> {
+    const device = new LaunchControlXL3({ enableCustomModes: true });
+    await device.connect();
+    return new LaunchControlXL3Adapter(device);
+  }
+
+  async connect(): Promise<void> {
+    await this.device.connect();
+  }
+
+  async disconnect(): Promise<void> {
+    await this.device.disconnect();
+  }
+
+  isConnected(): boolean {
+    return this.device.isConnected();
+  }
+
+  async listConfigurations(): Promise<ConfigurationSlot[]> {
+    const slots: ConfigurationSlot[] = [];
+    for (let i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
+      const mode = await this.device.readCustomMode(i);
+      slots.push({
+        index: i,
+        name: mode?.name,
+        isEmpty: mode === null
+      });
+    }
+    return slots;
+  }
+
+  async readConfiguration(slot: number): Promise<ControllerConfiguration> {
+    const customMode = await this.device.readCustomMode(slot);
+    if (!customMode) {
+      throw new Error(`No configuration in slot ${slot}`);
+    }
+
+    // Convert LCXL3 CustomMode â†’ generic ControllerConfiguration
+    return {
+      name: customMode.name,
+      controls: this.convertControls(customMode.controls),
+      metadata: customMode.metadata
+    };
+  }
+
+  async writeConfiguration(slot: number, config: ControllerConfiguration): Promise<void> {
+    // Convert generic ControllerConfiguration â†’ LCXL3 CustomMode
+    const customMode = this.convertToCustomMode(config);
+    await this.device.writeCustomMode(slot, customMode);
+  }
+
+  async getDeviceInfo(): Promise<DeviceInfo> {
+    const info = await this.device.verifyDevice();
+    return {
+      manufacturer: 'Novation',
+      model: 'Launch Control XL 3',
+      firmwareVersion: info.firmwareVersion
+    };
+  }
+
+  private convertControls(controls: any): ControlMapping[] {
+    const mappings: ControlMapping[] = [];
+    for (const [key, control] of Object.entries(controls)) {

+        name: (control as any).name,
+        type: (control as any).type,
+        cc: (control as any).ccNumber,
+        channel: (control as any).midiChannel,
+        range: [(control as any).minValue, (control as any).maxValue]
+      });
+    }
+    return mappings;

+## Phase 3: Launch Control XL3 Converter
+
+**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/converters/LaunchControlXL3Converter.ts`
+
+\```typescript
+export class LaunchControlXL3Converter implements CanonicalConverterInterface {
+
+  getConverterInfo(): ConverterInfo {
+    return {
+      supportedController: 'Novation Launch Control XL 3',
+      version: '1.0.0',
+      features: ['custom-modes', 'label-preservation', 'all-control-types']
+    };
+  }
+
+  canConvert(config: ControllerConfiguration): boolean {
+    // Validate config has required LCXL3 structure
+    return config.controls.length > 0 &&
+           config.controls.every(c => c.cc !== undefined);
+  }
+
+  convert(
+    config: ControllerConfiguration,
+    options: ConversionOptions
+  ): CanonicalMidiMap {
+    return {
+      version: '1.0.0',
+      device: {
+        manufacturer: 'Novation',
+        model: 'Launch Control XL 3',
+        ...(options.deviceOverrides || {})
+      },
+      metadata: {
+        name: config.name,
+        description: `Converted from LCXL3 custom mode: ${config.name}`,
+        date: new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0],
+        tags: ['launch-control-xl3', 'auto-generated']
+      },
+      plugin: options.pluginInfo,
+      midi_channel: options.midiChannel,
+      controls: this.mapControls(config.controls, options)
+    };
+  }
+
+  private mapControls(controls: ControlMapping[], options: ConversionOptions): ControlDefinition[] {
+    return controls.map(control => ({
+      id: this.mapControlId(control.id),        // SEND_A1 â†’ encoder_1
+      name: options.preserveLabels ? control.name : this.getDefaultName(control.id),
+      type: this.mapControlType(control.type),
+      cc: control.cc!,
+      channel: control.channel ?? options.midiChannel ?? 0,
+      range: control.range || [0, 127],
+      description: `Mapped from ${control.id}`
+    }));
+  }
+
+  private mapControlId(lcxl3Id: string): string {
+    // LCXL3-specific mapping: SEND_A1 â†’ encoder_1, FADER1 â†’ slider_1, etc.
+    const mapping: Record<string, string> = {
+      'SEND_A1': 'encoder_1', 'SEND_A2': 'encoder_2', 'SEND_A3': 'encoder_3',
+      'SEND_A4': 'encoder_4', 'SEND_A5': 'encoder_5', 'SEND_A6': 'encoder_6',
+      'SEND_A7': 'encoder_7', 'SEND_A8': 'encoder_8',
+      'SEND_B1': 'encoder_9', 'SEND_B2': 'encoder_10', 'SEND_B3': 'encoder_11',
+      'SEND_B4': 'encoder_12', 'SEND_B5': 'encoder_13', 'SEND_B6': 'encoder_14',
+      'SEND_B7': 'encoder_15', 'SEND_B8': 'encoder_16',
+      'PAN1': 'encoder_17', 'PAN2': 'encoder_18', 'PAN3': 'encoder_19',
+      'PAN4': 'encoder_20', 'PAN5': 'encoder_21', 'PAN6': 'encoder_22',
+      'PAN7': 'encoder_23', 'PAN8': 'encoder_24',
+      'FADER1': 'slider_1', 'FADER2': 'slider_2', 'FADER3': 'slider_3',
+      'FADER4': 'slider_4', 'FADER5': 'slider_5', 'FADER6': 'slider_6',
+      'FADER7': 'slider_7', 'FADER8': 'slider_8',
+      'FOCUS1': 'button_1', 'FOCUS2': 'button_2', 'FOCUS3': 'button_3',
+      'FOCUS4': 'button_4', 'FOCUS5': 'button_5', 'FOCUS6': 'button_6',
+      'FOCUS7': 'button_7', 'FOCUS8': 'button_8',
+      'CONTROL1': 'button_9', 'CONTROL2': 'button_10', 'CONTROL3': 'button_11',
+      'CONTROL4': 'button_12', 'CONTROL5': 'button_13', 'CONTROL6': 'button_14',
+      'CONTROL7': 'button_15', 'CONTROL8': 'button_16'
+    };
+    return mapping[lcxl3Id] || lcxl3Id.toLowerCase();
+  }
+
+  private mapControlType(type: ControlType): 'encoder' | 'slider' | 'button' | 'button_group' {
+    return type;
+  }
+
+  private getDefaultName(controlId: string): string {
+    return controlId.replace(/_/g, ' ').replace(/\b\w/g, l => l.toUpperCase());
+  }
+}
+\```

+## Phase 4: Generalized Deployment Workflow
+
+**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/orchestrator/DeploymentWorkflow.ts`
+
+\```typescript
+import { EventEmitter } from 'eventemitter3';
+
+export interface WorkflowOptions {
+  configSlot: number;
+  targets: string[];
+  pluginInfo?: PluginDefinition;
+  midiChannel?: number;
+  preserveLabels?: boolean;
+  outputDir?: string;
+  autoInstall?: boolean;
+  dryRun?: boolean;
+}
+
+export interface WorkflowResult {
+  success: boolean;
+  controllerConfig?: ControllerConfiguration;
+  canonicalMap?: CanonicalMidiMap;
+  deployments: DeploymentResult[];
+  errors: string[];
+}
+
+export interface CreateOptions {
+  controllerAdapter?: ControllerAdapterInterface;
+  targets: string[];
+}
+
+export class DeploymentWorkflow extends EventEmitter {
+  constructor(
+    private controllerAdapter: ControllerAdapterInterface,
+    private converter: CanonicalConverterInterface,
+    private deployers: Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>
+  ) {
+    super();
+  }
+
+  static async create(options: CreateOptions): Promise<DeploymentWorkflow> {
+    // Auto-detect controller or use specified adapter
+    const adapter = options.controllerAdapter || await this.detectController();
+
+    // Get appropriate converter for detected controller
+    const converter = this.getConverterFor(adapter);
+
+    // Initialize DAW deployers
+    const deployers = new Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>();
+    if (options.targets.includes('ardour')) {
+      const { ArdourDeployer } = await import('../adapters/daws/ArdourDeployer.js');
+      deployers.set('ardour', new ArdourDeployer());
+    }
+    if (options.targets.includes('live')) {
+      const { LiveDeployer } = await import('../adapters/daws/LiveDeployer.js');
+      deployers.set('live', new LiveDeployer());
+    }
+
+    return new DeploymentWorkflow(adapter, converter, deployers);
+  }
+
+  async execute(options: WorkflowOptions): Promise<WorkflowResult> {
+    const errors: string[] = [];
+
+    try {
+      // Step 1: Read configuration from controller
+      this.emit('progress', { step: 1, message: 'Reading controller configuration...' });
+      const config = await this.controllerAdapter.readConfiguration(options.configSlot);
+
+      // Step 2: Convert to canonical format
+      this.emit('progress', { step: 2, message: 'Converting to canonical format...' });
+      const canonicalMap = this.converter.convert(config, {
+        pluginInfo: options.pluginInfo,
+        midiChannel: options.midiChannel,
+        preserveLabels: options.preserveLabels ?? true
+      });
+
+      // Step 3: Save canonical YAML (optional)
+      if (options.outputDir) {
+        await this.saveCanonical(canonicalMap, options.outputDir);
+      }
+
+      // Step 4: Deploy to each target DAW
+      this.emit('progress', { step: 3, message: 'Deploying to DAWs...' });
+      const deployments: DeploymentResult[] = [];
+
+      for (const target of options.targets) {
+        const deployer = this.deployers.get(target);
+        if (deployer) {
+          const result = await deployer.deploy(canonicalMap, {
+            autoInstall: options.autoInstall,
+            dryRun: options.dryRun
+          });
+          deployments.push(result);
+          if (!result.success) {
+            errors.push(...(result.errors || [`${target} deployment failed`]));
+          }
+        } else {
+          errors.push(`No deployer available for ${target}`);
+        }
+      }
+
+      return {
+        success: deployments.every(d => d.success) && errors.length === 0,
+        controllerConfig: config,
+        canonicalMap,
+        deployments,
+        errors
+      };
+
+    } catch (error) {
+      errors.push(error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error));
+      return {
+        success: false,
+        deployments: [],
+        errors
+      };
+    }
+  }
+
+  getControllerAdapter(): ControllerAdapterInterface {
+    return this.controllerAdapter;
+  }
+
+  private async saveCanonical(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, outputDir: string): Promise<void> {
+    const yaml = await import('yaml');
+    const { writeFileSync, mkdirSync } = await import('fs');
+    const { join } = await import('path');
+
+    mkdirSync(outputDir, { recursive: true });
+    const filename = `${canonicalMap.device.model.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-')}-${canonicalMap.metadata.name.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-')}.yaml`;
+    const filepath = join(outputDir, filename);
+
+    writeFileSync(filepath, yaml.stringify(canonicalMap));
+    this.emit('canonical-saved', { path: filepath });
+  }
+
+  private static async detectController(): Promise<ControllerAdapterInterface> {
+    // Try to detect connected controller
+    // Start with LCXL3, add more controllers later
+    try {
+      const { LaunchControlXL3Adapter } = await import('../adapters/controllers/LaunchControlXL3Adapter.js');
+      return await LaunchControlXL3Adapter.create();
+    } catch {
+      throw new Error('No supported controller detected');
+    }
+  }
+
+  private static getConverterFor(adapter: ControllerAdapterInterface): CanonicalConverterInterface {
+    // Registry of converters by controller model
+    if (adapter.model === 'Launch Control XL 3') {
+      const { LaunchControlXL3Converter } = require('../converters/LaunchControlXL3Converter.js');
+      return new LaunchControlXL3Converter();
+    }
+    throw new Error(`No converter available for ${adapter.model}`);
+  }
+}
+\```
+

+- âœ… Works with any ControllerAdapterInterface
+- âœ… Auto-detects connected controller
+- âœ… Supports multiple DAW targets simultaneously
+- âœ… Event-based progress reporting
+- âœ… Comprehensive error handling

+## Phase 6: DAW Deployers
+
+### Ardour Deployer
+
+**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/adapters/daws/ArdourDeployer.ts`
+
+\```typescript
+import { MidiMapBuilder, ArdourXMLSerializer } from '@oletizi/ardour-midi-maps';
+
+export class ArdourDeployer implements DAWDeployerInterface {
+  readonly dawName = 'Ardour';
+  readonly version = '8.0';
+
+  async deploy(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, options: DeploymentOptions): Promise<DeploymentResult> {
+    try {
+      // Convert canonical â†’ Ardour XML
+      const ardourMap = this.convertToArdour(canonicalMap);
+      const serializer = new ArdourXMLSerializer();
+      const xml = serializer.serializeMidiMap(ardourMap);
+
+      // Determine output path
+      const outputPath = options.outputPath || await this.getDefaultOutputPath(canonicalMap);
+
+      if (!options.dryRun) {
+        const { writeFileSync, mkdirSync } = await import('fs');
+        const { dirname } = await import('path');
+
+        mkdirSync(dirname(outputPath), { recursive: true });
+        writeFileSync(outputPath, xml);
+
+        // Install to Ardour config if requested
+        if (options.autoInstall) {
+          const configDir = await this.getConfigDirectory();
+          const { basename, join } = await import('path');
+          const installPath = join(configDir, basename(outputPath));
+          writeFileSync(installPath, xml);
+          return {
+            success: true,
+            dawName: this.dawName,
+            outputPath: installPath,
+            installed: true
+          };
+        }
+      }
+
+      return {
+        success: true,
+        dawName: this.dawName,
+        outputPath,
+        installed: false
+      };
+
+    } catch (error) {
+      return {
+        success: false,
+        dawName: this.dawName,
+        errors: [error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)]
+      };
+    }
+  }
+
+  async isInstalled(): Promise<boolean> {
+    const { existsSync } = await import('fs');
+    try {
+      const configDir = await this.getConfigDirectory();
+      return existsSync(configDir);
+    } catch {
+      return false;
+    }
+  }
+
+  async getConfigDirectory(): Promise<string> {
+    const { homedir } = await import('os');
+    const { join } = await import('path');
+    const home = homedir();
+
+    switch (process.platform) {
+      case 'darwin':
+        return join(home, 'Library', 'Preferences', 'Ardour8', 'midi_maps');
+      case 'linux':
+        return join(home, '.config', 'ardour8', 'midi_maps');
+      case 'win32':
+        return join(home, 'AppData', 'Local', 'Ardour8', 'midi_maps');
+      default:
+        throw new Error(`Unsupported platform: ${process.platform}`);
+    }
+  }
+
+  private convertToArdour(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap): any {
+    // Use existing ardour-midi-maps conversion logic
+    const builder = new MidiMapBuilder({
+      name: `${canonicalMap.device.manufacturer} ${canonicalMap.device.model}`,
+      version: canonicalMap.version
+    });
+
+    // Convert controls
+    for (const control of canonicalMap.controls) {
+      if (control.type === 'button') {
+        builder.addNoteBinding({
+          channel: control.channel as number,
+          note: control.cc!,
+          function: control.plugin_parameter ?
+            `/route/plugin/parameter S1 1 ${control.plugin_parameter}` :
+            'transport-stop'
+        });
+      } else {
+        builder.addCCBinding({
+          channel: control.channel as number,
+          controller: control.cc!,
+          function: control.plugin_parameter ?
+            `/route/plugin/parameter S1 1 ${control.plugin_parameter}` :
+            'track-set-gain[1]',
+          encoder: control.type === 'encoder'
+        });
+      }
+    }
+
+    return builder.build();
+  }
+
+  private async getDefaultOutputPath(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap): Promise<string> {
+    const { join } = await import('path');
+    const filename = `${canonicalMap.device.manufacturer.toLowerCase()}-${canonicalMap.device.model.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-')}.map`;
+    return join(process.cwd(), 'dist', 'ardour-maps', filename);
+  }
+}
+\```

+## Phase 8: AI Parameter Matching Service

+**Objective:** Implement Claude AI-powered fuzzy matching to automatically map hardware control names to plugin parameter indices.

+**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/services/ParameterMatcher.ts`

+- Dual Claude integration: Anthropic API (primary), CLI (fallback)

+- Error handling: graceful degradation if AI unavailable
+- Caching: Save matches in canonical YAML for reuse
+- Timeout handling: 30s default, configurable
+

+## Future Controller Support (Extensibility)
+
+### Adding a New Controller
+
+**Required Steps:**
+
+1. **Create Controller Adapter**
+   \```typescript
+   // src/adapters/controllers/NewControllerAdapter.ts
+   export class NewControllerAdapter implements ControllerAdapterInterface {
+     // Implement all interface methods
+   }
+   \```
+
+2. **Create Converter**
+   \```typescript
+   // src/converters/NewControllerConverter.ts
+   export class NewControllerConverter implements CanonicalConverterInterface {
+     // Implement conversion logic
+   }
+   \```
+
+3. **Register in Workflow**
+   \```typescript
+   // Update DeploymentWorkflow.detectController()
+   // Update DeploymentWorkflow.getConverterFor()
+   \```
+
+**Potential Future Controllers:**
+- Behringer X-Touch / X32
+- Novation Launchpad
+- Akai APC series
+- Native Instruments Maschine
+- Any controller with SysEx configuration

+   351â†’      features: ['custom-modes', 'label-preservation', 'all-control-types']
+   352â†’    };
+   353â†’  }
+   354â†’
+   355â†’  canConvert(config: ControllerConfiguration): boolean {
+   356â†’    // Validate config has required LCXL3 structure
+   357â†’    return config.controls.length > 0 &&
+   358â†’           config.controls.every(c => c.cc !== undefined);
+   359â†’  }
+   360â†’
+   361â†’  convert(
+   362â†’    config: ControllerConfiguration,
+   363â†’    options: ConversionOptions
+   364â†’  ): CanonicalMidiMap {
+   365â†’    return {
+   366â†’      version: '1.0.0',
+   367â†’      device: {
+   368â†’        manufacturer: 'Novation',
+   369â†’        model: 'Launch Control XL 3',
+   370â†’        ...(options.deviceOverrides || {})
+   371â†’      },
+   372â†’      metadata: {
+   373â†’        name: config.name,
+   374â†’        description: `Converted from LCXL3 custom mode: ${config.name}`,
+   375â†’        date: new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0],
+   376â†’        tags: ['launch-control-xl3', 'auto-generated']
+   377â†’      },
+   378â†’      plugin: options.pluginInfo,
+   379â†’      midi_channel: options.midiChannel,
+   380â†’      controls: this.mapControls(config.controls, options)
+   381â†’    };
+   382â†’  }
+   383â†’
+   384â†’  private mapControls(controls: ControlMapping[], options: ConversionOptions): ControlDefinition[] {
+   385â†’    return controls.map(control => ({
+   386â†’      id: this.mapControlId(control.id),        // SEND_A1 â†’ encoder_1
+   387â†’      name: options.preserveLabels ? control.name : this.getDefaultName(control.id),
+   388â†’      type: this.mapControlType(control.type),
+   389â†’      cc: control.cc!,
+   390â†’      channel: control.channel ?? options.midiChannel ?? 0,
+   391â†’      range: control.range || [0, 127],
+   392â†’      description: `Mapped from ${control.id}`
+   393â†’    }));
+   394â†’  }
+   395â†’
+   396â†’  private mapControlId(lcxl3Id: string): string {
+   397â†’    // LCXL3-specific mapping: SEND_A1 â†’ encoder_1, FADER1 â†’ slider_1, etc.
+   398â†’    const mapping: Record<string, string> = {
+   399â†’      'SEND_A1': 'encoder_1', 'SEND_A2': 'encoder_2', 'SEND_A3': 'encoder_3',
+   400â†’      'SEND_A4': 'encoder_4', 'SEND_A5': 'encoder_5', 'SEND_A6': 'encoder_6',
+   401â†’      'SEND_A7': 'encoder_7', 'SEND_A8': 'encoder_8',
+   402â†’      'SEND_B1': 'encoder_9', 'SEND_B2': 'encoder_10', 'SEND_B3': 'encoder_11',
+   403â†’      'SEND_B4': 'encoder_12', 'SEND_B5': 'encoder_13', 'SEND_B6': 'encoder_14',
+   404â†’      'SEND_B7': 'encoder_15', 'SEND_B8': 'encoder_16',
+   405â†’      'PAN1': 'encoder_17', 'PAN2': 'encoder_18', 'PAN3': 'encoder_19',
+   406â†’      'PAN4': 'encoder_20', 'PAN5': 'encoder_21', 'PAN6': 'encoder_22',
+   407â†’      'PAN7': 'encoder_23', 'PAN8': 'encoder_24',
+   408â†’      'FADER1': 'slider_1', 'FADER2': 'slider_2', 'FADER3': 'slider_3',
+   409â†’      'FADER4': 'slider_4', 'FADER5': 'slider_5', 'FADER6': 'slider_6',
+   410â†’      'FADER7': 'slider_7', 'FADER8': 'slider_8',
+   411â†’      'FOCUS1': 'button_1', 'FOCUS2': 'button_2', 'FOCUS3': 'button_3',
+   412â†’      'FOCUS4': 'button_4', 'FOCUS5': 'button_5', 'FOCUS6': 'button_6',
+   413â†’      'FOCUS7': 'button_7', 'FOCUS8': 'button_8',
+   414â†’      'CONTROL1': 'button_9', 'CONTROL2': 'button_10', 'CONTROL3': 'button_11',
+   415â†’      'CONTROL4': 'button_12', 'CONTROL5': 'button_13', 'CONTROL6': 'button_14',
+   416â†’      'CONTROL7': 'button_15', 'CONTROL8': 'button_16'
+   417â†’    };
+   418â†’    return mapping[lcxl3Id] || lcxl3Id.toLowerCase();
+   419â†’  }
+   420â†’
+   421â†’  private mapControlType(type: ControlType): 'encoder' | 'slider' | 'button' | 'button_group' {
+   422â†’    return type;
+   423â†’  }
+   424â†’
+   425â†’  private getDefaultName(controlId: string): string {
+   426â†’    return controlId.replace(/_/g, ' ').replace(/\b\w/g, l => l.toUpperCase());
+   427â†’  }
+   428â†’}

+   440â†’## Phase 4: Generalized Deployment Workflow
+   441â†’
+   442â†’**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/orchestrator/DeploymentWorkflow.ts`
+   443â†’
+   444â†’\```typescript
+   445â†’import { EventEmitter } from 'eventemitter3';
+   446â†’
+   447â†’export interface WorkflowOptions {
+   448â†’  configSlot: number;
+   449â†’  targets: string[];
+   450â†’  pluginInfo?: PluginDefinition;
+   451â†’  midiChannel?: number;
+   452â†’  preserveLabels?: boolean;
+   453â†’  outputDir?: string;
+   454â†’  autoInstall?: boolean;
+   455â†’  dryRun?: boolean;
+   456â†’}
+   457â†’
+   458â†’export interface WorkflowResult {
+   459â†’  success: boolean;
+   460â†’  controllerConfig?: ControllerConfiguration;
+   461â†’  canonicalMap?: CanonicalMidiMap;
+   462â†’  deployments: DeploymentResult[];
+   463â†’  errors: string[];
+   464â†’}
+   465â†’
+   466â†’export interface CreateOptions {
+   467â†’  controllerAdapter?: ControllerAdapterInterface;
+   468â†’  targets: string[];
+   469â†’}
+   470â†’
+   471â†’export class DeploymentWorkflow extends EventEmitter {
+   472â†’  constructor(
+   473â†’    private controllerAdapter: ControllerAdapterInterface,
+   474â†’    private converter: CanonicalConverterInterface,
+   475â†’    private deployers: Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>
+   476â†’  ) {
+   477â†’    super();
+   478â†’  }
+   479â†’
+   480â†’  static async create(options: CreateOptions): Promise<DeploymentWorkflow> {
+   481â†’    // Auto-detect controller or use specified adapter
+   482â†’    const adapter = options.controllerAdapter || await this.detectController();
+   483â†’
+   484â†’    // Get appropriate converter for detected controller
+   485â†’    const converter = this.getConverterFor(adapter);
+   486â†’
+   487â†’    // Initialize DAW deployers
+   488â†’    const deployers = new Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>();
+   489â†’    if (options.targets.includes('ardour')) {
+   490â†’      const { ArdourDeployer } = await import('../adapters/daws/ArdourDeployer.js');
+   491â†’      deployers.set('ardour', new ArdourDeployer());
+   492â†’    }
+   493â†’    if (options.targets.includes('live')) {
+   494â†’      const { LiveDeployer } = await import('../adapters/daws/LiveDeployer.js');
+   495â†’      deployers.set('live', new LiveDeployer());
+   496â†’    }
+   497â†’
+   498â†’    return new DeploymentWorkflow(adapter, converter, deployers);
+   499â†’  }
+   500â†’
+   501â†’  async execute(options: WorkflowOptions): Promise<WorkflowResult> {
+   502â†’    const errors: string[] = [];
+   503â†’
+   504â†’    try {
+   505â†’      // Step 1: Read configuration from controller
+   506â†’      this.emit('progress', { step: 1, message: 'Reading controller configuration...' });
+   507â†’      const config = await this.controllerAdapter.readConfiguration(options.configSlot);
+   508â†’
+   509â†’      // Step 2: Convert to canonical format
+   510â†’      this.emit('progress', { step: 2, message: 'Converting to canonical format...' });
+   511â†’      const canonicalMap = this.converter.convert(config, {
+   512â†’        pluginInfo: options.pluginInfo,
+   513â†’        midiChannel: options.midiChannel,
+   514â†’        preserveLabels: options.preserveLabels ?? true
+   515â†’      });
+   516â†’
+   517â†’      // Step 3: Save canonical YAML (optional)
+   518â†’      if (options.outputDir) {
+   519â†’        await this.saveCanonical(canonicalMap, options.outputDir);
+   520â†’      }
+   521â†’
+   522â†’      // Step 4: Deploy to each target DAW
+   523â†’      this.emit('progress', { step: 3, message: 'Deploying to DAWs...' });
+   524â†’      const deployments: DeploymentResult[] = [];
+   525â†’
+   526â†’      for (const target of options.targets) {
+   527â†’        const deployer = this.deployers.get(target);
+   528â†’        if (deployer) {
+   529â†’          const result = await deployer.deploy(canonicalMap, {
+   530â†’            autoInstall: options.autoInstall,
+   531â†’            dryRun: options.dryRun
+   532â†’          });
+   533â†’          deployments.push(result);
+   534â†’          if (!result.success) {
+   535â†’            errors.push(...(result.errors || [`${target} deployment failed`]));
+   536â†’          }
+   537â†’        } else {
+   538â†’          errors.push(`No deployer available for ${target}`);
+   539â†’        }
+   540â†’      }
+   541â†’
+   542â†’      return {
+   543â†’        success: deployments.every(d => d.success) && errors.length === 0,
+   544â†’        controllerConfig: config,
+   545â†’        canonicalMap,
+   546â†’        deployments,
+   547â†’        errors
+   548â†’      };
+   549â†’
+   550â†’    } catch (error) {
+   551â†’      errors.push(error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error));
+   552â†’      return {
+   553â†’        success: false,
+   554â†’        deployments: [],
+   555â†’        errors
+   556â†’      };
+   557â†’    }
+   558â†’  }
+   559â†’
+   560â†’  getControllerAdapter(): ControllerAdapterInterface {
+   561â†’    return this.controllerAdapter;
+   562â†’  }
+   563â†’
+   564â†’  private async saveCanonical(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, outputDir: string): Promise<void> {
+   565â†’    const yaml = await import('yaml');
+   566â†’    const { writeFileSync, mkdirSync } = await import('fs');
+   567â†’    const { join } = await import('path');
+   568â†’
+   569â†’    mkdirSync(outputDir, { recursive: true });
+   570â†’    const filename = `${canonicalMap.device.model.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-')}-${canonicalMap.metadata.name.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-')}.yaml`;
+   571â†’    const filepath = join(outputDir, filename);
+   572â†’
+   573â†’    writeFileSync(filepath, yaml.stringify(canonicalMap));
+   574â†’    this.emit('canonical-saved', { path: filepath });
+   575â†’  }
+   576â†’
+   577â†’  private static async detectController(): Promise<ControllerAdapterInterface> {
+   578â†’    // Try to detect connected controller

+   580â†’    try {

+   582â†’      return await LaunchControlXL3Adapter.create();
+   583â†’    } catch {
+   584â†’      throw new Error('No supported controller detected');
+   585â†’    }
+   586â†’  }
+   587â†’
+   588â†’  private static getConverterFor(adapter: ControllerAdapterInterface): CanonicalConverterInterface {
+   589â†’    // Registry of converters by controller model
+   590â†’    if (adapter.model === 'Launch Control XL 3') {
+   591â†’      const { LaunchControlXL3Converter } = require('../converters/LaunchControlXL3Converter.js');
+   592â†’      return new LaunchControlXL3Converter();
+   593â†’    }
+   594â†’    throw new Error(`No converter available for ${adapter.model}`);
+   595â†’  }
+   596â†’}

+   816â†’  private convertToArdour(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap): any {

+## Integration Details
+
+### Workflow Position
+The ParameterMatcher integration runs as **Step 1.5** in the deployment workflow:
+
+1. **Step 1:** Read controller configuration from hardware
+2. **Step 1.5:** AI-match control names to plugin parameters (NEW)
+3. **Step 2:** Convert to canonical format
+4. **Step 3:** Deploy to DAW-specific formats
+
+### Execution Flow
+1. Check if `--plugin` option is provided
+2. If yes, import ParameterMatcher dynamically
+3. Load plugin descriptor from canonical-midi-maps registry
+4. Extract non-empty control names from config
+5. Call ParameterMatcher.matchParameters() with 0.6 confidence threshold
+6. Apply matches to controller config by adding plugin_parameter field
+7. Display match statistics and warnings
+8. Continue to Step 2 regardless of matching success/failure
+
+### Error Handling
+- **Plugin descriptor not found:** Shows warning, continues without matching
+- **No control names:** Shows warning, skips matching
+- **AI matching fails:** Shows error message, continues deployment
+- **Low confidence matches:** Shows warnings but applies matches
+
+### Configuration
+- **Minimum confidence:** 0.6 (60%)
+- **Low confidence warning threshold:** 0.7 (70%)
+- **Dynamic import:** ParameterMatcher loaded only when needed
+

+## Phase 8: AI Parameter Matching Service
+
+**Objective:** Implement Claude AI-powered fuzzy matching to automatically map hardware control names to plugin parameter indices.
+
+**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/services/ParameterMatcher.ts`
+
+### Components
+
+1. **ParameterMatcherInterface** - Core matching interface
+2. **ParameterMatcher** - Implementation with Claude integration
+3. **Plugin descriptor loader** - Load parameter databases
+4. **Claude integration** - Dual method (API + CLI fallback)
+5. **Confidence scoring** - Match quality metrics
+
+### Implementation Requirements
+
+- Load plugin descriptors from canonical-midi-maps registry
+- Dual Claude integration: Anthropic API (primary), CLI (fallback)
+- Semantic matching: exact, abbreviation, synonym recognition
+- Confidence scoring: 0-1 scale with reasoning
+- Error handling: graceful degradation if AI unavailable
+- Caching: Save matches in canonical YAML for reuse
+- Timeout handling: 30s default, configurable
+
+### Integration Points
+
+**Deploy workflow (deploy.ts):**
+\```typescript
+if (options.plugin) {
+  const matcher = ParameterMatcher.create();
+  const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor(options.plugin);
+  const matches = await matcher.matchParameters(controlNames, descriptor);
+
+  // Add plugin_parameter fields to controls
+  config.controls.forEach((control, i) => {
+    if (matches[i]?.pluginParameter) {
+      control.plugin_parameter = matches[i].pluginParameter;
+    }
+  });
+}
+\```
+
+### Testing Strategy
+
+- Mock Claude responses for deterministic tests
+- Test confidence thresholds (0.6 minimum)
+- Test graceful degradation (API failure â†’ CLI fallback)
+- Test parameter validation
+- Test caching behavior
+- Integration test with real TAL-J-8 descriptor
+

+- [ ] Performance benchmarks (<5s for 48 controls)

+## Integration Details
+
+### Workflow Position
+The ParameterMatcher integration runs as **Step 1.5** in the deployment workflow:
+
+1. **Step 1:** Read controller configuration from hardware
+2. **Step 1.5:** AI-match control names to plugin parameters (NEW)
+3. **Step 2:** Convert to canonical format
+4. **Step 3:** Deploy to DAW-specific formats
+
+### Execution Flow
+1. Check if `--plugin` option is provided
+2. If yes, import ParameterMatcher dynamically
+3. Load plugin descriptor from canonical-midi-maps registry
+4. Extract non-empty control names from config
+5. Call ParameterMatcher.matchParameters() with 0.6 confidence threshold
+6. Apply matches to controller config by adding plugin_parameter field
+7. Display match statistics and warnings
+8. Continue to Step 2 regardless of matching success/failure
+
+### Error Handling
+- **Plugin descriptor not found:** Shows warning, continues without matching
+- **No control names:** Shows warning, skips matching
+- **AI matching fails:** Shows error message, continues deployment
+- **Low confidence matches:** Shows warnings but applies matches
+
+### Configuration
+- **Minimum confidence:** 0.6 (60%)
+- **Low confidence warning threshold:** 0.7 (70%)
+- **Dynamic import:** ParameterMatcher loaded only when needed
+

+    44â†’
+    45â†’### Configuration
+    46â†’
+    47â†’#### API vs CLI
+    48â†’
+    49â†’The matcher supports two Claude integration methods:
+    50â†’
+    51â†’1. **Anthropic API** (recommended):
+    52â†’   \```bash
+    53â†’   export ANTHROPIC_API_KEY="your-api-key"
+    54â†’   \```
+    55â†’
+    56â†’2. **Claude CLI** (fallback):
+    57â†’   \```bash
+    58â†’   npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude
+    59â†’   claude auth
+    60â†’   \```
+    61â†’
+    62â†’If `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` is set, the API will be used. Otherwise, it falls back to the CLI.
+    63â†’
+    64â†’#### Match Options
+    65â†’
+    66â†’\```typescript
+    67â†’interface MatchOptions {
+    68â†’  minConfidence?: number;        // 0-1, default 0.5
+    69â†’  preserveControlNames?: boolean; // Preserve original names
+    70â†’  customPrompt?: string;         // Custom system prompt
+    71â†’  timeout?: number;              // Request timeout in ms
+    72â†’}
+    73â†’\```
+    74â†’
+    75â†’### Advanced Usage
+    76â†’
+    77â†’#### Custom Prompts
+    78â†’
+    79â†’You can provide a custom system prompt to guide matching behavior:
+    80â†’
+    81â†’\```typescript
+    82â†’const results = await matcher.matchParameters(controls, descriptor, {
+    83â†’  customPrompt: `You are an expert at mapping MIDI controls to synthesizer parameters.
+    84â†’Focus on common synthesizer workflows and standard naming conventions.
+    85â†’Consider these priority mappings:
+    86â†’- Cutoff â†’ Filter Frequency
+    87â†’- Res â†’ Filter Resonance
+    88â†’- Atk â†’ Envelope Attack
+    89â†’...`
+    90â†’});
+    91â†’\```
+    92â†’
+    93â†’#### Filtering by Confidence
+    94â†’
+    95â†’\```typescript
+    96â†’const highConfidenceMatches = results.filter(r => r.confidence >= 0.8);
+    97â†’const unknownControls = results.filter(r => r.pluginParameter === undefined);
+    98â†’\```
+    99â†’
+   100â†’#### Integration with Deployment Workflow
+   101â†’
+   102â†’\```typescript
+   103â†’// Match parameters
+   104â†’const matches = await matcher.matchParameters(controlNames, descriptor);
+   105â†’
+   106â†’// Add to canonical map
+   107â†’const canonicalMap = {
+   108â†’  name: 'My Controller',
+   109â†’  plugin: descriptor.plugin,
+   110â†’  bindings: matches.map((match, index) => ({
+   111â†’    control: match.controlName,
+   112â†’    cc: index + 1,
+   113â†’    parameter: match.pluginParameter,
+   114â†’    name: match.parameterName,
+   115â†’  })),
+   116â†’};
+   117â†’\```
+   118â†’
+   119â†’### Plugin Descriptor Loading
+   120â†’
+   121â†’The `loadPluginDescriptor` function loads plugin descriptors from the canonical-midi-maps registry:
+   122â†’
+   123â†’\```typescript
+   124â†’// By plugin name (case-insensitive, space-insensitive)
+   125â†’const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('TAL-J-8');
+   126â†’const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal j 8');
+   127â†’const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8');
+   128â†’
+   129â†’// All normalize to the same descriptor file
+   130â†’\```
+   131â†’
+   132â†’### Error Handling
+   133â†’
+   134â†’\```typescript
+   135â†’try {
+   136â†’  const results = await matcher.matchParameters(controls, descriptor);
+   137â†’} catch (error) {
+   138â†’  if (error.message.includes('API request failed')) {
+   139â†’    // Handle API errors (rate limits, auth, etc.)
+   140â†’  } else if (error.message.includes('timeout')) {
+   141â†’    // Handle timeout
+   142â†’  } else if (error.message.includes('Plugin descriptor not found')) {
+   143â†’    // Handle missing plugin descriptor
+   144â†’  }
+   145â†’}
+   146â†’\```
+   147â†’
+   148â†’### Performance Considerations
+   149â†’
+   150â†’- **API Response Time**: Typical 2-5 seconds for 10-20 controls
+   151â†’- **Rate Limits**: Anthropic API has rate limits; consider caching results
+   152â†’- **Batch Processing**: Process multiple controllers sequentially to avoid rate limits
+   153â†’- **Timeouts**: Default 30s should handle most plugins; increase for large plugins (>500 params)
+   154â†’
+   155â†’### Examples
+   156â†’
+   157â†’See `/examples/parameter-matching-example.ts` for a complete working example.
+   158â†’
+   159â†’### Testing
+   160â†’
+   161â†’Unit tests use mocked Claude responses to avoid API calls:
+   162â†’

+   178â†’
+   179â†’### Architecture
+   180â†’
+   181â†’The ParameterMatcher follows interface-first design:
+   182â†’
+   183â†’- **Interface**: `ParameterMatcherInterface` - contract for matching implementations
+   184â†’- **Implementation**: `ParameterMatcher` - Claude AI-based implementation
+   185â†’- **Factory Pattern**: `ParameterMatcher.create()` for dependency injection
+   186â†’- **Composition**: No inheritance, uses functional composition
+   187â†’
+   188â†’### Future Enhancements
+   189â†’
+   190â†’- Rule-based fallback matcher for offline usage
+   191â†’- Caching layer for common plugin/control combinations
+   192â†’- Learning from user corrections
+   193â†’- Support for multi-plugin scenarios
+   194â†’- Parameter group awareness (envelope, filter, oscillator)
+   195â†’

+```md
+# Controller Workflow Services
+
+Intelligent services for controller configuration and plugin mapping.
+
+## ParameterMatcher
+
+The `ParameterMatcher` service uses Claude Code CLI to intelligently match hardware controller control names to plugin parameters based on semantic similarity, common naming conventions, and audio engineering domain knowledge.
+
+### Features
+
+- **AI-Powered Matching**: Uses Claude Code CLI for intelligent parameter matching
+- **Confidence Scoring**: Provides 0-1 confidence scores for each match
+- **Semantic Understanding**: Recognizes common abbreviations and synonyms
+- **Plugin Descriptor Support**: Works with the canonical-midi-maps plugin descriptor registry
+- **Timeout Handling**: Configurable timeouts for CLI requests
+- **Error Handling**: Robust error handling for CLI failures
+
+### Requirements
+
+**Claude Code CLI must be installed and authenticated:**
+
+\```bash
+# Claude Code is already installed on your system
+# Verify it's working:
+claude --version
+
+# If you need to authenticate:
+claude auth
+\```
+
+### Basic Usage
+
+\```typescript
+import { ParameterMatcher, loadPluginDescriptor } from '@oletizi/controller-workflow';
+
+// Load plugin descriptor
+const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal-j-8');
+
+// Create matcher instance
+const matcher = ParameterMatcher.create({
+  minConfidence: 0.6,  // Minimum confidence threshold
+  timeout: 30000,      // 30 second timeout
+});
+
+// Match control names to parameters
+const hardwareControls = ['Cutoff', 'Resonance', 'Attack', 'Release'];
+const results = await matcher.matchParameters(hardwareControls, descriptor);
+
+// Process results
+for (const result of results) {
+  if (result.pluginParameter !== undefined) {
+    console.log(`${result.controlName} â†’ ${result.parameterName}`);
+    console.log(`  Confidence: ${result.confidence}`);
+    console.log(`  Parameter Index: ${result.pluginParameter}`);
+  }
+}
+\```
+
+### Configuration
+
+#### Match Options
+
+\```typescript
+interface MatchOptions {
+  minConfidence?: number;        // 0-1, default 0.5
+  preserveControlNames?: boolean; // Preserve original names
+  customPrompt?: string;         // Custom system prompt
+  timeout?: number;              // Request timeout in ms
+}
+\```
+
+### Advanced Usage
+
+#### Custom Prompts
+
+You can provide a custom system prompt to guide matching behavior:
+
+\```typescript
+const results = await matcher.matchParameters(controls, descriptor, {
+  customPrompt: `You are an expert at mapping MIDI controls to synthesizer parameters.
+Focus on common synthesizer workflows and standard naming conventions.
+Consider these priority mappings:
+- Cutoff â†’ Filter Frequency
+- Res â†’ Filter Resonance
+- Atk â†’ Envelope Attack
+...`
+});
+\```
+
+#### Filtering by Confidence
+
+\```typescript
+const highConfidenceMatches = results.filter(r => r.confidence >= 0.8);
+const unknownControls = results.filter(r => r.pluginParameter === undefined);
+\```
+
+#### Integration with Deployment Workflow
+
+\```typescript
+// Match parameters
+const matches = await matcher.matchParameters(controlNames, descriptor);
+
+// Add to canonical map
+const canonicalMap = {
+  name: 'My Controller',
+  plugin: descriptor.plugin,
+  bindings: matches.map((match, index) => ({
+    control: match.controlName,
+    cc: index + 1,
+    parameter: match.pluginParameter,
+    name: match.parameterName,
+  })),
+};
+\```
+
+### Plugin Descriptor Loading
+
+The `loadPluginDescriptor` function loads plugin descriptors from the canonical-midi-maps registry:
+
+\```typescript
+// By plugin name (case-insensitive, space-insensitive)
+const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('TAL-J-8');
+const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal j 8');
+const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8');
+
+// All normalize to the same descriptor file
+\```
+
+### Error Handling
+
+\```typescript
+try {
+  const results = await matcher.matchParameters(controls, descriptor);
+} catch (error) {
+  if (error.message.includes('Failed to spawn Claude CLI')) {
+    // Handle CLI not found or spawn errors
+    console.error('Claude Code CLI is not installed or not in PATH');
+  } else if (error.message.includes('timeout')) {
+    // Handle timeout
+    console.error('Claude CLI request timed out - try increasing timeout');
+  } else if (error.message.includes('exited with code')) {
+    // Handle CLI execution errors
+    console.error('Claude CLI failed to execute');
+  } else if (error.message.includes('Plugin descriptor not found')) {
+    // Handle missing plugin descriptor
+    console.error('Plugin not found in registry');
+  }
+}
+\```
+
+### Performance Considerations
+
+- **CLI Response Time**: Typical 2-10 seconds for 10-20 controls (depends on Claude Code CLI performance)
+- **Batch Processing**: Process multiple controllers sequentially to avoid spawning too many processes
+- **Timeouts**: Default 30s should handle most plugins; increase for large plugins (>500 params)
+- **Caching**: Consider caching results for frequently used plugin/control combinations
+
+### Examples
+
+See `/examples/parameter-matching-example.ts` for a complete working example.
+
+### Testing
+
+Unit tests use mocked `spawn` to avoid actual CLI calls:
+
+\```typescript
+import { ParameterMatcher } from '@oletizi/controller-workflow';
+import { vi } from 'vitest';
+import { spawn } from 'child_process';
+
+// Mock spawn
+vi.mock('child_process', () => ({
+  spawn: vi.fn(),
+}));
+
+// Create mock process
+const mockProc = {
+  stdout: { on: vi.fn() },
+  stderr: { on: vi.fn() },
+  stdin: { write: vi.fn(), end: vi.fn() },
+  on: vi.fn((event, handler) => {
+    if (event === 'close') handler(0);
+  }),
+};
+
+vi.mocked(spawn).mockReturnValue(mockProc);
+
+const results = await matcher.matchParameters(controls, descriptor);
+\```
+
+### Architecture
+
+The ParameterMatcher follows interface-first design:
+
+- **Interface**: `ParameterMatcherInterface` - contract for matching implementations
+- **Implementation**: `ParameterMatcher` - Claude Code CLI-based implementation
+- **Factory Pattern**: `ParameterMatcher.create()` for dependency injection
+- **Composition**: No inheritance, uses functional composition
+
+### Implementation Details
+
+#### How it Works
+
+1. **Prompt Construction**: Builds a detailed prompt with plugin parameters and control names
+2. **CLI Invocation**: Spawns `claude` command and pipes prompt to stdin
+3. **Response Parsing**: Extracts JSON from Claude's response (handles markdown code blocks)
+4. **Validation**: Validates parameter indices and confidence scores
+5. **Filtering**: Applies minimum confidence threshold
+
+#### CLI Command
+
+The service spawns the Claude Code CLI as:
+
+\```bash
+claude < prompt.txt
+\```
+
+The prompt is piped to stdin, and the response is read from stdout.
+
+#### Response Format
+
+Claude is instructed to respond with JSON:
+
+\```json
+[
+  {
+    "controlName": "Cutoff",
+    "parameterIndex": 42,
+    "parameterName": "Filter Cutoff",
+    "confidence": 0.95,
+    "reasoning": "Direct semantic match"
+  }
+]
+\```
+
+### Future Enhancements
+
+- Rule-based fallback matcher for offline usage
+- Caching layer for common plugin/control combinations
+- Learning from user corrections
+- Support for multi-plugin scenarios
+- Parameter group awareness (envelope, filter, oscillator)
+- Batch processing optimization for multiple controllers
+

++## Why It Won't Work Automatically
++
++The `jupiter_8.map` file we generated contains **generic parameter URIs** like:

++
++But TAL Jupiter 8 has **specific parameter names** like:
++- `/plugins/parameter/cutoff`
++- `/plugins/parameter/resonance`
++- `/plugins/parameter/osc1_pitch`
++- etc.
++

++

++
++2. **Manually map in Ardour**:
++   - Enable MIDI Learn mode
++   - Click a TAL Jupiter 8 parameter
++   - Move the corresponding Launch Control knob
++   - Repeat for each parameter
++

++
++Regenerate the map with TAL Jupiter 8 parameter names:
++
++```bash
++node dist/cli/deploy.js deploy \
++  --slot 0 \

++  --midi-channel 0

++But this still requires you to **edit the generated .map file** to use TAL's actual parameter URIs.

++    31â†’## Phase 1: Plugin Interrogation
++    32â†’
++    33â†’### Purpose
++    34â†’
++    35â†’Extract accurate parameter information from audio plugins to ensure mappings use real, valid parameter indices.
++    36â†’
++    37â†’### Prerequisites
++    38â†’
++    39â†’- JUCE-based plughost binary (built from project)
++    40â†’- Installed VST3 plugins
++    41â†’- canonical-midi-maps module
++    42â†’
++    43â†’### Process
++    44â†’
++    45â†’#### Step 1: Build Plugin Host
++    46â†’
++    47â†’\```bash
++    48â†’# From project root
++    49â†’cd path/to/juce-plughost
++    50â†’make
++    51â†’# Binary output: build/plughost
++    52â†’\```
++    53â†’
++    54â†’#### Step 2: Run Batch Interrogation
++    55â†’
++    56â†’\```bash
++    57â†’# Navigate to canonical-midi-maps
++    58â†’cd modules/audio-control/modules/canonical-midi-maps
++    59â†’
++    60â†’# Run batch plugin scanning
++    61â†’pnpm plugin:generate-batch
++    62â†’\```
++    63â†’
++    64â†’**What happens:**
++    65â†’1. Launches `plughost` with `--batch-interrogate` flag
++    66â†’2. Scans all VST3 plugins in standard directories
++    67â†’3. Skips problematic plugins (UAD, etc.)
++    68â†’4. Extracts parameter information for each plugin
++    69â†’5. Outputs JSON stanzas to log file
++    70â†’6. Caches results for 24 hours
++    71â†’
++    72â†’#### Step 3: Process Results
++    73â†’
++    74â†’The batch generator automatically:
++    75â†’- Reads JSON stanzas from plughost output
++    76â†’- Converts to structured plugin descriptors
++    77â†’- Categorizes parameters (oscillator, filter, envelope, etc.)
++    78â†’- Saves individual descriptor files
++    79â†’- Updates catalog index
++    80â†’
++    81â†’### Output
++    82â†’
++    83â†’\```
++    84â†’plugin-descriptors/

++    87â†’â”œâ”€â”€ analogobsession-channev.json           # Channel strip
++    88â†’â””â”€â”€ plugins-catalog-batch.json             # Master catalog
++    89â†’\```

++   141â†’## Phase 2: Canonical Mapping
++   142â†’
++   143â†’### Purpose

++   487â†’List connected controllers and available configurations.

++   504â†’
++   505â†’### controller-deploy deploy
++   506â†’
++   507â†’Deploy controller configuration to DAW(s).
++   508â†’
++   509â†’**Options:**
++   510â†’- `-c, --controller <type>`: Controller type (auto-detect if omitted)
++   511â†’- `-s, --slot <number>`: Configuration slot (default: 0)
++   512â†’- `-d, --daw <daws...>`: Target DAWs (default: ardour)
++   513â†’- `-p, --plugin <name>`: Plugin name for context
++   514â†’- `-m, --midi-channel <number>`: MIDI channel override
++   515â†’- `-o, --output <dir>`: Output directory for canonical YAML
++   516â†’- `--install`: Auto-install to DAW config directories
++   517â†’- `--dry-run`: Preview without deploying
++   518â†’
++   519â†’**Examples:**
++   520â†’\```bash
++   521â†’# Basic deployment
++   522â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour
++   523â†’
++   524â†’# Multiple DAWs
++   525â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live
++   526â†’
++   527â†’# With plugin context
++   528â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --daw ardour
++   529â†’
++   530â†’# Save canonical and install
++   531â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --output ./mappings --install
++   532â†’
++   533â†’# Preview only
++   534â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour --dry-run
++   535â†’\```
++   536â†’
++   537â†’## Troubleshooting
++   538â†’
++   539â†’### Plugin Interrogation Issues
++   540â†’
++   541â†’**Problem:** Plugin crashes during scan
++   542â†’\```bash
++   543â†’# Skip problematic plugins by editing
++   544â†’modules/canonical-midi-maps/src/tools/batch-plugin-generator.ts
++   545â†’
++   546â†’const SKIP_PATTERNS = [
++   547â†’  /UAD/i,           # Universal Audio plugins
++   548â†’  /Waves/i,         # Waves plugins (if problematic)
++   549â†’  /YourPlugin/i     # Add problematic plugin
++   550â†’];
++   551â†’\```
++   552â†’
++   553â†’**Problem:** No parameters found
++   554â†’- Check plugin format (VST3 required)
++   555â†’- Verify plugin is installed correctly
++   556â†’- Try manual interrogation: `plughost --interrogate /path/to/plugin.vst3`
++   557â†’
++   558â†’### Canonical Mapping Issues
++   559â†’
++   560â†’**Problem:** Wrong parameter indices
++   561â†’- Verify plugin descriptor exists and is current
++   562â†’- Check parameter index in descriptor JSON
++   563â†’- Regenerate descriptor if plugin was updated
++   564â†’
++   565â†’**Problem:** YAML validation errors
++   566â†’- Check YAML syntax (indentation, colons, quotes)
++   567â†’- Verify required fields (version, device, plugin, controls)
++   568â†’- Use YAML validator: `npx js-yaml --validate mapping.yaml`
++   569â†’
++   570â†’### Deployment Issues
++   571â†’
++   572â†’**Problem:** Ardour map not appearing
++   573â†’- Check installation path: `~/Library/Preferences/Ardour8/midi_maps/`
++   574â†’- Verify XML is valid: `xmllint --noout mapping.map`
++   575â†’- Restart Ardour after installation
++   576â†’
++   577â†’**Problem:** Live mapping not working
++   578â†’- Check `plugin-mappings.json` syntax
++   579â†’- Verify runtime-loader is loading file
++   580â†’- Check Max for Live device logs
++   581â†’- Ensure plugin name matches exactly
++   582â†’
++   583â†’**Problem:** Controller not detected
++   584â†’- Check MIDI connections (Web MIDI API requires Chrome/Edge)
++   585â†’- Verify controller is powered on
++   586â†’- Try manual adapter creation (bypass auto-detection)
++   587â†’
++   588â†’## Performance Tips
++   589â†’
++   590â†’### Cache Plugin Descriptors
++   591â†’
++   592â†’Plugin interrogation is cached for 24 hours. To force refresh:
++   593â†’\```bash
++   594â†’rm plugin-descriptors/plugins-catalog-batch.json
++   595â†’pnpm plugin:generate-batch
++   596â†’\```
++   597â†’
++   598â†’### Batch Deployments
++   599â†’
++   600â†’Deploy multiple configurations in one script:
++   601â†’\```bash
++   602â†’#!/bin/bash
++   603â†’for slot in {0..3}; do
++   604â†’  npx controller-deploy deploy --slot $slot --daw ardour live --install
++   605â†’done
++   606â†’\```
++   607â†’
++   608â†’### Validate Before Deploy
++   609â†’
++   610â†’Use dry-run to verify before actual deployment:
++   611â†’\```bash
++   612â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live --dry-run
++   613â†’# Review output, then run without --dry-run
++   614â†’npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live --install
++   615â†’\```

++++# Feature 360: MIDI Controller â†’ DAW Deployment Pipeline
++++
++++**Version:** 1.21
++++**Status:** In Progress
++++**Branch:** `feat/cc-mapping-360`
++++
++++## Overview
++++
++++The 360 feature provides a complete "round-trip" workflow for deploying MIDI controller configurations to multiple DAWs. The name "360" reflects the comprehensive, full-circle nature of the workflow: extract configuration from hardware â†’ convert to canonical format â†’ deploy to any supported DAW.
++++
++++### Key Capabilities
++++
++++1. **Device Interrogation**: Read custom mode configurations from MIDI controllers
++++2. **Canonical Mapping**: Convert device-specific formats to universal canonical MIDI maps
++++3. **Multi-DAW Deployment**: Generate and deploy to Ardour, Ableton Live, and future DAWs
++++4. **One-Click Workflow**: Single command from controller extraction to DAW installation
++++
++++### Supported Hardware
++++
++++- **Current**: Novation Launch Control XL 3 (reference implementation)
++++- **Future**: Any MIDI controller with programmable custom modes
++++
++++### Supported DAWs
++++
++++- **Ardour**: Full support (MIDI map XML generation and installation)
++++- **Ableton Live**: Dual-pipeline mapping system (canonical + runtime JSON)
++++- **Future**: Reaper, Bitwig, and other DAWs
++++

++++# Feature 360 Architecture
++++
++++**Version:** 1.21
++++**Status:** In Progress
++++**Last Updated:** 2025-10-11
++++
++++## Overview
++++
++++The 360 feature implements a modular, extensible architecture for deploying MIDI controller configurations to multiple DAWs. The design follows interface-first principles with clear separation of concerns across three main layers:
++++
++++1. **Controller Abstraction Layer** - Hardware interrogation and configuration extraction
++++2. **Canonical Conversion Layer** - Format translation to universal MIDI mappings
++++3. **DAW Deployment Layer** - Platform-specific map generation and installation
++++

++++## Core Components
++++
++++### 1. Controller-Workflow Module
++++
++++**Purpose:** Generic framework for controller â†’ DAW deployment
++++
++++**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/`
++++
++++**Key Abstractions:**
++++
++++```typescript
++++// Controller interrogation interface
++++interface ControllerAdapterInterface {
++++  connect(): Promise<void>;
++++  listConfigurations(): Promise<ConfigurationSlot[]>;
++++  readConfiguration(slot: number): Promise<ControllerConfiguration>;
++++}
++++
++++// Canonical conversion interface
++++interface CanonicalConverterInterface {
++++  convert(config: ControllerConfiguration, options: ConversionOptions): CanonicalMidiMap;
++++  canConvert(config: ControllerConfiguration): boolean;
++++}
++++
++++// DAW deployment interface
++++interface DAWDeployerInterface {
++++  deploy(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, options: DeploymentOptions): Promise<DeploymentResult>;
++++  isInstalled(): Promise<boolean>;
++++}
++++```
++++
++++**Design Principles:**
++++- **Interface-first:** All adapters implement well-defined interfaces
++++- **Dependency injection:** Components accept dependencies via constructor
++++- **Factory pattern:** Auto-detection and instantiation via factories
++++- **Event-driven:** Progress reporting via EventEmitter
++++
++++See [implementation/workplan.md](./implementation/workplan.md) for detailed design.
++++
++++### 2. Launch Control XL3 Adapter

++++**Purpose:** Reference implementation for Novation Launch Control XL 3

++++**Capabilities:**

++++- Map LCXL3-specific IDs (SEND_A1, FADER1, etc.) to generic control types
++++- Wrapper around existing launch-control-xl3 library

++++### 3. Canonical MIDI Maps
++++
++++**Purpose:** Universal MIDI mapping format (DAW-agnostic)
++++
++++**Location:** `modules/canonical-midi-maps/`
++++
++++**Format:** YAML
++++
++++**Structure:**
++++```yaml
++++version: 1.0.0
++++
++++device:
++++  manufacturer: Novation
++++  model: Launch Control XL 3
++++
++++plugin:
++++  manufacturer: TAL Software
++++  name: TAL-J-8
++++  descriptor: plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json
++++
++++metadata:
++++  name: Jupiter-8 Template
++++  description: Controls for TAL-J-8 synth
++++  date: 2025-10-11
++++
++++midi_channel: 1  # Global MIDI channel
++++
++++controls:
++++  - id: encoder_1
++++    name: VCF Cutoff
++++    type: encoder
++++    cc: 13
++++    channel: 1
++++    plugin_parameter: 105  # Real parameter index from descriptor
++++    range: [0, 127]
++++```
++++
++++**Key Features:**
++++- **Real parameter indices:** Uses plugin descriptors for accurate mappings
++++- **Hardware abstraction:** Generic control IDs work across devices
++++- **Plugin awareness:** Links to plugin descriptors for validation
++++- **Metadata rich:** Version tracking, tags, creation dates
++++
++++See [project ARCHITECTURE.md](../../ARCHITECTURE.md) for component relationships.

++++

++++                    { ...CANONICAL_PLUGIN_MAPS, ...runtimeMaps }

++++
++++**Benefits:**
++++- **Tier 1** provides curated, version-controlled defaults

++++## Extensibility
++++
++++### Adding a New Controller
++++
++++1. **Implement ControllerAdapter:**
++++   ```typescript
++++   export class NewControllerAdapter implements ControllerAdapterInterface {
++++     // Implement all interface methods
++++   }
++++   ```
++++
++++2. **Implement CanonicalConverter:**
++++   ```typescript
++++   export class NewControllerConverter implements CanonicalConverterInterface {
++++     convert(config: ControllerConfiguration, options: ConversionOptions): CanonicalMidiMap {
++++       // Device-specific â†’ canonical mapping
++++     }
++++   }
++++   ```
++++
++++3. **Register in Workflow:**
++++   - Update `DeploymentWorkflow.detectController()`
++++   - Update `DeploymentWorkflow.getConverterFor()`
++++
++++**No changes required:** Orchestrator, CLI, DAW deployers all work generically.
++++
++++### Adding a New DAW
++++
++++1. **Implement DAWDeployer:**
++++   ```typescript
++++   export class NewDAWDeployer implements DAWDeployerInterface {
++++     async deploy(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, options: DeploymentOptions): Promise<DeploymentResult> {
++++       // Generate DAW-specific format
++++     }
++++   }
++++   ```
++++
++++2. **Register in Workflow:**
++++   - Update `DeploymentWorkflow.create()` to include new deployer
++++
++++**No changes required:** Controller adapters, converters, orchestrator all work generically.

++++## Technology Stack
++++
++++| Layer | Technologies |
++++|-------|--------------|
++++| **Core** | TypeScript 5.3+, ESM modules, Strict mode |
++++| **MIDI** | WebMIDI API (browsers), node-midi (Node.js), SysEx parsing |
++++| **Data Formats** | YAML (canonical), JSON (runtime), XML (Ardour) |
++++| **Build** | Vite (bundling), TypeScript compiler, pnpm workspaces |
++++| **Testing** | Vitest, dependency injection for mocking |
++++| **Documentation** | Markdown, JSDoc, TypeScript types as documentation |
++++
++++## Design Patterns
++++
++++### Interface-First Design
++++
++++All major components define interfaces before implementation:
++++- Enables testing with mocks
++++- Clear contracts between layers
++++- Easier to extend and maintain
++++
++++### Dependency Injection
++++
++++```typescript
++++export class DeploymentWorkflow {
++++  constructor(
++++    private controllerAdapter: ControllerAdapterInterface,
++++    private converter: CanonicalConverterInterface,
++++    private deployers: Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>
++++  ) {}
++++}
++++```
++++
++++Benefits:
++++- Testable (inject mocks)
++++- Flexible (swap implementations)
++++- Follows project guidelines
++++
++++### Factory Pattern
++++
++++```typescript
++++static async create(options: CreateOptions): Promise<DeploymentWorkflow> {
++++  const adapter = options.controllerAdapter || await this.detectController();
++++  const converter = this.getConverterFor(adapter);
++++  const deployers = new Map();
++++  // ...
++++  return new DeploymentWorkflow(adapter, converter, deployers);
++++}
++++```
++++
++++Benefits:
++++- Auto-detection of hardware
++++- Simplified instantiation
++++- Encapsulates complexity
++++
++++### Event-Driven Progress
++++
++++```typescript
++++workflow.on('progress', ({ step, message }) => {
++++  console.log(`[${step}/3] ${message}`);
++++});
++++
++++workflow.on('canonical-saved', ({ path }) => {
++++  console.log(`Saved: ${path}`);
++++});
++++```
++++
++++Benefits:
++++- Real-time feedback
++++- Decoupled UI/logging
++++- Extensible event system
++++
++++## Performance Considerations
++++
++++### Target Metrics
++++
++++| Operation | Target | Current Status |
++++|-----------|--------|----------------|
++++| Controller read | <2s | âœ… Sub-second |
++++| Canonical conversion | <100ms | â³ Not measured |
++++| Ardour XML generation | <50ms | â³ Not measured |
++++| Live JSON write | <20ms | âœ… Instant |
++++| End-to-end workflow | <10s | â³ Not measured |
++++
++++### Optimization Strategies
++++
++++- **Caching:** Controller configurations cached between deployments
++++- **Lazy loading:** DAW deployers loaded on-demand
++++- **Async operations:** Non-blocking I/O for file operations
++++- **Streaming:** Large maps processed in chunks
++++
++++## Security Considerations
++++
++++- **File system access:** Validates output paths before writing
++++- **MIDI input:** Validates SysEx messages before parsing
++++- **Command injection:** No shell command execution (direct API calls only)
++++- **Path traversal:** Sanitizes file paths in output directory options

++++**Component:** LiveDeployer (Ableton Live deployment)

++++## Overview
++++
